Mini-contest: Groups score 20 or above on Project Demo are eligible for the contest. The champion group will be guaranteed to obtain an A grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Lab04 and the Lab midterm might get a little intense, because you have so much to do in such a small amount of time. The questions they ask you in lab mainly tests your ability to use the equipment and some simple calculations, so it shouldn't be too much trouble as long as you know how to use the equipment.

- No Homework, but there is a final project based on all the labs.

- No final, but two midterms.

- There will be pop up quizzes during lectures with no make up, so try not to skip lectures lol.

- Lab midterm has three questions, where you'll have to build certain circuits (materials and schematic provided), but you're only given 75 minutes to build all three circuits and answer all the questions.

reviews.author: Anonymous_user
reviews.comment_content:
I like it:

The course introduces the fundamental knowledge on the design, implementation and evaluation of a robot and its sub-systems. It covers the basic principles of analog and digital circuits as well as robot sensing and control mechanisms. Students have to apply the knowledge and principles learned to design and build a functional robot by the end of the course.

Accelerated since in summer.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Exams: 1 Lab Exam (20%) and 1 Written Exam (20%), NO final exam
Labs: 6 Lab Assignments (20% total); minimum 4 labs’ attendance to be eligible for final project demo.
Quiz: a few Pop-up In-class quizzes (open book) (10% total)
Project: Demo (25%) and Report (5%)
reviews.comment_workload: Fair. Final project may be slightly more than expected.

reviews.author: AnonymousKerr
reviews.title: Good Professor
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite a lot to remember but easy to understand since the professor is Song. From basics to complicated stuffs, we need to implement all of them to the final project which is making a robot with arduino.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Song is really nice in terms of teaching and as a friend. He will teach you in Chinese, Cantonese, and English until you understand. You can meet him frequently at Hang Hau or North Bus with his family and he will greet you. The IA is exceptional, when everyone thought IA will be cruel, but the actual is vice versa. She even help us out completely during the labs which makes everyone loves asking for her signature in labs
reviews.comment_grading: The teacher and the IA are very nice and helpful. Always answer our questions whenever possible. Some of the TA's in lab are not nice (you can spot them easily) and only 2 TA's are really super duper nice including the TA which is Ms. Tang Yi Meng herself
reviews.comment_workload: You need to go back and forth to the lab to finish the project, but after the lessons (theories) ended, we don't have classes only projects which kinda fun.

reviews.author: jc2048
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture includes some basic knowledge about physics including current, voltage etc, then to some deeper stuff which includes transistors, KCL&KVL, logic table, arduino programming, some electronic components such as timer and H-Bridge etc.

Lab session aims to teach you how to create a robot car using the knowledge you learned from lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor explains the contents very clearly. You can also ask him questions after the lecture and he is very willing to answer you.

Tutorials are useless, since they only introduces the content of lab sessions and does not teach anything.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading includes lab mid-term, one written exam, IPRS sessions in almost every lecture, lab assignments, project demo (a robot car), and project report.

The lab mid-term and written exam is not hard if you paid attention in  lectures, lab assignments are also not difficult, but the project demo maybe hard to get high marks because the car always encounter some random problems. If you managed to solve all of them then it is very easy to get an A grade
reviews.comment_workload:
Most of the workload comes from the robot car, which needs a lot of time to calibrate and improve the circuit. You will need to spend many hours into fixing and testing the car.

You will also need to pair up with another person in the project, therefore it is better to find another friend who knows teamwork well.

reviews.author: Krap
reviews.comment_content: A project oriented course. It teaches all the knowledge you need to have in order to build and program an autonomous vehicle and also the theories behind, including basic electronics, PWM, transistors, sensors, KCL&KVL, logics, K-map, Truth table, and arduino programming. The content overall isn't really difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Song is a good teacher, he explained things super clearly and interestingly.
He tries his best to make the lecture as interesting as possible and tries his best to interact with his students.

The last lecture was no longer about the course but more about coaching about university life and career for students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading content :
Lab
Lab Midterm
Final Project
Final Exam
Quiz in class
Final project report

it is easy to get full mark on lab, lab midterm, quiz, report.
you need a little effort for final exam and final project and you will get full mark
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is not really much. you need to finish the final project and do the programming. And at last, you just need to make the final report based on the final project.

The amount of debugging that you might need for your lab project depends on the overall complexity and also how well you've designed the logic.

overall, the workload is not really heavy.

reviews.author: holdee
reviews.title: Good Professor
reviews.comment_content: basic electronics stuffs with some complicated equations such as KCL, KVL and some Arduino programming.
reviews.comment_teaching: Extremely good teaching, I am one of those students who never go to lessons in university but Professor Song is the only professor in that semester where I never skipped his classes and even paid full attention during his lectures. I still remembered that he sent an email to us after knowing our grades for midterm were not satisfactory, teaching us that "Life does not have grading, there is no A+ students or C- students", definitely one of the most inspiring professors.
reviews.comment_grading: I got B- but still Professor Song has taught me not only a satisfactory ELEC course, but a valuable life lesson.
reviews.comment_workload: Its a 4 credit course so it a little bit heavier than usual, but still the content of labs are fun and quite easy to complete, otherwise there is not much work.

reviews.author: Eldreda
reviews.comment_content:
18 Lectures, every lecture has 1 or 2 quizzes

6 Labs, attend minimum 4 labs to be eligible to do the final project

The project is to make a car that could follow and finish a certain track given to you by using all the components and knowledge that you know in the whole course

We use Arduino to program the car instead of doing it using hardware only to do all the logics
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor and all the TAs are good at teaching and know their stuff. They are also approachable and feel comfortable around students so we could ask questions or just have a little. chat with them.

During lab, most of the TAs are friendly and willing to help you if you really can't solve a problem by yourself (debugging not giving answers).
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is very good
20% Lab Mid term
20% Lab assignments (6 labs)
10% Quiz in every lecture (only highest 70% will be counted)
25% Final Project
5% Project report

There is a mini-contest for the final project that you might want to participate and win. If you win, you will be guaranteed to have an A as your grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Little workload at the beginning, no homework. However, near the end of the course we have to do lots of stuffs to finish the final project

The time you spend on the projects really affect the result of your project. You need to find and spend quite lots of time to make adjustments and to make sure that everything will go well during the final demo as you only have 1 chance if you won't choose to do the early demo (which the deadline is 1 or 2 weeks before the final demo)

reviews.author: CS水泡
reviews.comment_content:
This course teaches the basics of electronics like ohms law and basic circuit analysis. The main part is to build a vehicle that follows a line on the track(instructions and materials are provided). You'll need to code an Arduino MCU to control the logic which is miles easier than pure logic gates.

It is not that far from high school physics: transistors, PWM, truth table, K-Map, logic gates, KCL&KVL.

KCL & KVL are about the only new concept but you can simply use ohms law for more than half of the question in the written exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures cover the topics as mentioned in the content.

Tutorials are just a recap and usually unnecessary.

Labs account for most of the grades and it is helpful to plan ahead for the next lab. Prepare space on your breadboard for other components and do colour code your wires for debugging purpose.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab midterm: 20%
Written Exam: 20%
Lab assignment: 20% (minimum 4 attendance to attend the final project)
In class iPRS(only counts highest 70%): 10%
Project: 30%
    Project Demo: 24+1% (the 1% belongs to returning the box)
    Report: 5%

There's a mini contest that you can sign up for if you get 20 or above in the demo. It is to repeat the whole thing in the demo, and then back to the starting point. The fastest group with a perfect run guarantee an A grade.

Do mind that this course has become highly competitive and it takes a 90+% for an A. Most are just checklist items tho.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much work if you were merely finishing the tasks if you have a clear plan and logic flow of the program, fine-tuning may take some time but it isn't hard.

reviews.author: Eva.h
reviews.comment_content: The content is just about right for first year students.. Manageable and fun at the same time
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is alright, the prof sometimes digress from main content but it helps to make the material less dry
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is rather straightforward but bellcurve is rather steep for tests and all.. To receive a good grade, one should aim to constantly achieve jear full marks for all tests
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is rather manageable, in fact very little.. no assignments, just have to turn up for lectures, and tests and project

reviews.author: Benedict P
reviews.comment_content: Very easy and straightforward. Quite interesting with good practical applications.
reviews.comment_teaching: Great teaching
reviews.comment_grading: As long as you do well on the midterms and do not mess up the final project, you should get a good grade. There are two midterms, a conceptual midterm, and a practical midterm conducted in the lab. There is no final but there will be a final project which you will work on for the majority of the course. The final project has a final project demo day where you will test your project.
reviews.comment_workload: Final project has heavy workload

reviews.author: Don2000
reviews.comment_content: Including hardware and software. This sem we use Arduino instead, so light programming is added into the course
reviews.comment_teaching: the prof. is great, but need students to ask meaningful questions.TA are helpful, if you struggle on a problem, ask for help!
reviews.comment_grading: Lab exam is easy but important, deserver more time on it.
reviews.comment_workload:
a lab a week, the last few labs need more time on it.
Mid-term is quite normal, but some student score very hight, which makes it hard to score high.
But in Lab exam is easy to score full marks if you study before.However many of them don't. Better to spend more time on it.

Be aware of the in-class test, don't miss them.

reviews.author: jacky.k.p
reviews.title: Easy course with excellent grading
reviews.comment_content:
This course is teaching the basics of building a robot, starting from fundamental knowledge of voltage-current-resistence sort of things in DSE physics and different components that are useful in building a circuit.

No attendance is taken in all lectures, tutorial and labs. However, there will be 2-3 pop-up quizzes after the end of certain lecture that count towards the final grade and do not miss them. You have 1 lab partner in the group for the lab and a worksheet will be assigned for each lab.
Has 2 mid-terms (lab and written) but no final exams (project instead). The project is about building a robot with the provided materials. Starting from this semester though, the robot needs to be programmed by Arduino. Students with programming knowledge in C language may have a slight advantage in this project. There is also a mini-contest for those who passes the final project.
Overall, the course is easy for year 1 students to handle even without prior physics experience.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a good professor, encourage students to ask questions during the lectures and open to questions after lectures as well. Avoid chatting during the lecture though if you don't want to be called out, other things like sleeping is fine though.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading consists of 5 parts, including:
1. Pop-up quizzes (After the end of 2-3 lectures, OPEN-BOOK)
2. Lab Worksheets (1 per lab, bonus mark added to those who hand in within the firs 2 hours of the 3-hour lab)
3. Lab Mid-term (Close-book, SOLO)
4. Written Mid-term (Close-book, though exercises with very similar questions will be provided for revision.)
5. Final Project (including both an actual run of the robot and a written report, has quite a long period for preparation.)
(6.) Mini-contest (Get an A grade instantly with a win, outweighs all the above 5 aspects)

Got an A+ with everything full mark except written mid-term (around 93%).
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload varies with your lab partner.
Need some preparation before each lab if you want the 2-hour bonus mark.
Final project period is painful if you got free-rided, especially students without programming experience. With 20-40 hours of time allocated, you should have the robots working fine to get a full mark in the run.

reviews.author: Harris Wong
reviews.title: Not very good grading
reviews.comment_content: 2 open book pop-up quiz (6%), 6 labs (24%), 1 written mid-term (20%), 1 lab mid-term (15%), and final project (35%)
reviews.comment_teaching: Both the lectures and the tutorials are quite boring, so self- revision is very important. Tutorials are not necessary to attend as you have the following materials and the following tutorials are just focusing on the labs. No attendance will be scored for tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is not quite satisfactory. Any missing in the lab mid-term and final project will lead you to a bad grading. Many students got full marks in the final project but as they didn't do well in their written and lab mid-term so finally get C range. C range will be received if you only touch the mean.
reviews.comment_workload: As a 4 credit course, the workload is quite high. You need to do the lab for 2 hours a week. For the final project, you need to spend about 2 weeks to make to your robotic car by coding, so workload will be much more if you are not quite familiar with coding. If you want to freeride the lab, you will easily fail the lab mid-term.

reviews.author: Heyyo
reviews.comment_content: An awesome introduction course. It involves both hardware and software knowledge, and most importantly, the application of it through guidance. Very suitable for year one students.
reviews.comment_teaching: I'd say Yimeng helped us a lot during our lab sections, and especially during the last few labs when we were doing our project demo. Appreciate the efforts of the teaching team of this course a lot-very clearly instructed and help was always readily available.
reviews.comment_grading: Generally high gradings, so work to perfection if possible, if you want exceptional grades. Pay attention to your groupmate though. A good groupmate helps a lot and can be very encouraging.
reviews.comment_workload: Weekly lab sections, not hard at all-as long as you do slight preparation on them and be on time. The labs were the main workload, as there were no final exam (mid-term only) and homework.

reviews.author: JKay
reviews.comment_content: Lab sessions will be fun if you have a friendly teammate.
reviews.comment_teaching: I couldn't really understand what professors were saying since they murmured a lot. Yet, slides were good enough to learn necessary materials.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean was quite high for the final project, but it's easy to get in A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
Lab sessions usually took 1 - 2 hours. Other than that, did't require much study since all necessary materials were provided on tutorial sessions. Just read over tutorial notes before labs and quizzes.
Final project required some effort, but most of the stuff were already done during lab sessions.

reviews.author: Steeeve
reviews.comment_content:
Chap 1: Introduction
Chap 2: Components
Chap 3: Energy
Chap 4: DC Power Source
Chap 5: Pulse Generation
Chap 6: PWM Control
Chap 7: Transistor
Chap 8: H-bridge
Chap 9: Sensors
Chap 10: Logics
Chap 11: K-map

At the beginning of the contents, if you have studied Physics in your high school, it would not be too hard to understand the concept as those are what you have studied before such as Ohm's Law. Even though you haven't learned the other concepts like transistors, H-bridge, K-map or etc, it would not be impossible to get a good grade if you focus on the lectures and the tutorial classes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. MURCH is really awesome professor. His explanations are very helpful to understand unfamiliar topics. He also let us to feel free to ask questions not only during the lecture but also after the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Exams: 1 Written Midterm (20%) and Lab Midterm (15%), No final exam
Quiz: a few Pop-up In-class quizzes (open book) (6% total)
Labs: 6 Lab Assignments (4% each, 24% total); minimum 4 labs’ attendance to be eligible for final project demo.
Project: Project Demo (25%), Arduino Code Interview (5%), Project Report (5%)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is just reasonable. One of the advantages of this course is that there is no final exam so you would have more time to prepare for the other courses' final exams. In stead of taking final exam, you would do final project. Final project will be done by a group of 2 people. If you studied the topics that are taught through the lectures and spend lots of time on it, I believe that you would get a grade that you are aiming.

reviews.author: TheBest
reviews.comment_content: No final exams, 2 pop-up quiz, 6 labs, 1 written mid-term and one lab mid-term. 35% marks is obtained by the final project. (25% project demo, 5% interview, 5% report)
reviews.comment_teaching: Although the English pronunciation of TANG, Yimeng is not very well. If you know Putonghua, she is a very good professor which can answer all of your difficulties.
reviews.comment_grading: The average marks of the course is very high. You need to take higher than 98 marks to obtain a A+ grade. Only a C+/B- can be received if u scored mean in the course total marks.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite high

reviews.author: HHHooo
reviews.title: Very interesting course
reviews.comment_content:
The course basically teaches the basics of electronics.
It teaches about transistors, logic gates, Arduino coding and several types of integrated circuit. It clearly gives us the taste of the electronic engineering. The course is really fun.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is very helpful and kind. He is very willing to answer all the student's question even after the class hours. He explains in detail and he sometimes give the extra information which is good for us to know.
reviews.comment_grading:
Most of the students finishes the project with perfect run. So, the grading almost depends on the midterm lab and lectures, which are quite easy if you understand the lectures fully.

The grading scheme is:

Mid-term exam = 20%
Mid-term lab = 15%
6 lab works = 24%
Pop up quiz = 6%
Final project = 25%
Arduino code interview = 5%
Project report = 5%
reviews.comment_workload: There is no homework at all. So, only final few weeks will be quite busy to finish preparing for the final project. Other than that, there will be very little workload.

reviews.author: Tiffany Leung
reviews.comment_content:
quite easy to understand
introduction to electronic engineering
ELEC1100 is designed to provide the fundamental knowledge on the basic electrical engineering, components design and skills needed for the design, implementation and evaluation of a robot and its subsystems.
It will cover the basic electronic engineering principle and techniques.
Hands-on laboratory sessions, complemented with lectures and tutorials, are provided to allow students to have a systematic view of the electronic engineering principles.
Students will have to apply the knowledge and principles learnt to design and build a functional robot by themselves.
reviews.comment_teaching: interesting
reviews.comment_grading:
not leng grade as it seemed
85% and u get a B
89% still B+
92% still B+
Exams: 1 Written Midterm (20%) and Lab Midterm (15%), NO final exam
Quiz: a few Pop-up In-class quizzes (open book) (6% total)
Labs: 6 Lab Assignments (4% each, 24% total); minimum 4 labs’ attendance to be eligible for final project demo.
Project: Project Demo (25%), Arduino Code Interview (5%), Project Report (5%)
Mini-contest: Groups score 20 or above on Project Demo are eligible for the contest. The champion group will be guaranteed to obtain A grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
have to attend lesson (there are pop-up quizzes during lessons, u can take the quizzes in other lessons)
weekly lab
tutorials (no attendance)
final project (2 people in a group)

reviews.author: Bryan Lo
reviews.title: If you like CS, then you will love this course.
reviews.comment_content:
Basic physics electronics and some other in-depth stuff. (You can read it from other reviews). They are quite interesting I think but it takes a bit brain juice to understand each and everything taught. Lectures are useful for lab cuz you'll know what you are doing. (it's ok if you don't understand everything but if you mess up anything you'll be in deep trouble and you'll be extremely confused and have no idea what you are doing during the labs.)

***I definitely recommend you to know all the stuff*** cuz it will help you everything in the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not very intriguing to be honest and progress slightly slow in my opinion but that's ok I think. The English slightly difficult to hear (maybe because it's a bit monotonous...). But very enthusiastic and willing to answer your questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Overall: ~95% --> A

Good grade course ONLY if you are good at computer science OR have a very very logic mindset and you are a person who is very careful about every step.

Midterms:
Lab: 13 out of 15 (mean 10, +1 s.d.); Written: 89/100 (mean 78.2, +1 s.d.)
Get your concept clear and remember the stuff (not much to memorize, to be honest) you will ace through your midterms. Only reasons you will fail: Don't know what is going on throughout the course, or else you will do fine.

Labs:
Full mark for everything, you also should expect this, cuz even you have problems, raise up your hand and ask TA for help, they literally will do it for you (that's my case).

Project:
Do the labs perfectly then you'll have a good start. That's why LABS ARE VERY IMPORTANT. Not many tips for the final project but if you know and like computer science, the task should be easy for you. but there is one thing for sure
***READ IF YOU WANT PERFECT RUN***
1. Build everything carefully and don't try to mess up anything cuz debugging is painful.
2. Complete the program bit by bit, DON'T COMPLETE IT IN 1 GO cuz you'll be likely to fail the whole thing. Start with the first task, then the next, then after that. Gradually build the program while constantly testing your car.
3. If you face a problem, rethink your approach and don't rush through things, you need to get your head clear to find a solution.
reviews.comment_workload: Spend lots of time in labs that's for sure. Not many revisions are needed if you already understand everything during lectures. BUT for the final project, I cannot determine how much time you will use, some already have perfect run during the first demo (at least 1 week earlier than the last trial). In my case, some wires are connected incorrectly and I cannot find it so I unplug the whole thing (Yes I know its dumb but I did it) and rebuild everything from lab01 to lab06 within 2 hours and it worked. Unless you mess up big times or you are confident with your logic and concentration and carefulness, don't rebuild the whole thing no matter what. I spend around 8 hours of extra time to finish the thing (exclude lab time)

reviews.author: ppl
reviews.title: Good Grade
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction course to electrical engineering. This course aims to build a robot car that can follow a white path on a black mat.

Most of the content is covered in high school physics, which is most of the area tested in mid-term. The latter part of the course more focus on the constructing your own robot car, some new ideas like PWM and KMAP will be taught.

Contents include DC power, PWM, transistors, Hbridge, sensors, logic and KMAP.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is ok.
If you know the content, you don't really need to attend the lecture, but there will be open book pop quizzes in lectures. Tutorials only prepare you to do the next lab. TA only read out the powerpoint.
But TA is really helpful in lab and final project.
reviews.comment_grading:
A really clear grading scheme.
- 20% Written Midterm
- 15% Lab Midterm
- 6% Open Book Pop-up Quizzes in lectures
- 24% Lab Assignments
- 25% Project Demo
- 5% Arduino Code Review
- 5% Project Report

Lab assignments and project related marks are easy to get full marks.
If you understand the powerpoint slide and what the lab is doing, you can get a full mark in pop-up quizzes and all lab assignments.
If you spend time on the final project, you can get a full mark in the last 35% of marks.
I got 96.2 finally, grade A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload. All lessons will end at the last two weeks of the semester for you to do your project.

But it depends on how is your lab mate. If he/she work helps a lot then the workload is light.
Six labs throughout the whole semester, you must attend at least four of them. But you should not miss one of it since it will largely affect your project demo.

It changed to use Arduino Code to program the car, which is much easier.

reviews.author: beg_for_a_range
reviews.title: VERY GOOD COURSE
reviews.comment_content: A broad outline of the hardware part of electronic engineering. Also included some basic programming knowledge of c++ because this term the logic was designed by Arduino. But this course won't cover how the ICs work so you just put them together to maintain certain functions.
reviews.comment_teaching: I don't know how other professors develop their lectures. But Johnny's courses were a little boring. I think the most exciting part is the labs. You can really learn something through the labs.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is good. The midterm is very important because this is almost the only chance for you to get A range.
Exams: 1 written(20%) and lab(15%) mid-term; no final exam
Quiz: a few pop-up in-class quizzes(open book)(6% total)
Labs: 6lab assignments(4% each, 24% total); minimum 4 labs’ attendance to be eligible for a final project demo
Final project (35% total): Project Demo (25%), Arduino Code Interview (5%), Project Report (5%)
Mini-contest: Groups score 20or above on Project Demo are eligible for the contest. The champion group in the mini-contest will be guaranteed to obtain A grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The final project cost me a lot of time. But there's almost no other work you need to do.

reviews.author: clscompany
reviews.title: Good grade course with some workload
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to fundamental electronics.

The first few lessons are probably for students who didn’t take physics at high school. Basic electromagnetic(AC, DC, V=IR, P=IV) is introduced at first which is high school stuff. Later on, you need to learn the functions and structures of some electronics components such as the resistor, capacitor, ICs(Regulator, inverter, comparator, counter, H-bridge), diode and transistor. PWM control, logic, K-map and sensors are also taught. More advanced topics like sequential logic and programming language are not included in midterm but you need the concepts to help you finish the final project.

Everything is taught step by step and you should be able to catch up without attending the lessons. But there are two/three pop-up quiz.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Incredible. The professors and TAs are helpful.

Professor Murch is friendly and willing to answer our questions after the lessons. The lessons are a bit boring because of the contents. However, you can understand the content deeper and clearer by attending the lectures

Dr Tang is responsible for the lab and tutorial sessions. Her ascent could be difficult to understand. But she is very familiar with the circuits and super helpful. She helped my group to solve some challenging technical problems effectively and quickly. Better ask her if you face any crazy problems during the labs.
reviews.comment_grading:
Well, the grading is good. B range or even A grade is not difficult to achieve. But you need to be hardworking since many students are getting high marks.

Almost everyone scored full marks on assignments and the final project. Most likely the score of midterm and quiz would decide your grade.

My grade: A(~96-97%)
reviews.comment_workload:
You need to find one partner to do 6 labs(3hrs each) and the final project together. Choose wisely! Your workload definitely depends on your partner. You can either choose your partner or wait for random arrangement.

There are 2 lectures, 1 tutorial and 1 lab section every week. Workload increases significantly during the final project period. However, you can finish this course before dealing with other final exams.

reviews.author: michaell
reviews.comment_content:
ELEC1100 is designed to provide the fundamental knowledge on the basic electrical engineering, components design and skills needed for the design, implementation and evaluation of a robot and its subsystems.
It will cover the basic electronic engineering principle and techniques.
Hands-on laboratory sessions, complemented with lectures and tutorials, are provided to allow students to have a systematic view of the electronic engineering principles.
Students will have to apply the knowledge and principles learnt to design and build a functional robot by themselves.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pro Song's class is so good and he is very enthusiastic to reply our questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is so good.
If you got mean in midterm and got full marks in the final project and all labs, then should got A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
Exams: 1 Written Midterm (20%) and Lab Midterm (15%), NO final exam
Quiz: a few Pop-up In-class quizzes (open book) (8% total)
Labs: 7 Lab Assignments (22% total, first 6 labs 3% each, final lab 4%); minimum 4 labs’ attendance to be eligible for final project demo.
Project: Project Demo (25%), Post-demo Interview (5%), Project Report (5%)

reviews.author: andre
reviews.comment_content: The content mainly focus on logic gates and simple circuit design. The concepts are easy and basic.
reviews.comment_teaching: 9am class is difficult to focus however the lectures notes are self-explanatorily and easy to follow.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good as long as you make the final project works.
reviews.comment_workload: There are pop-up quizzes during lectures, a lab test and a final project. Quizzes are easy as long as you read the lecture notes beforehand. Lab test is basically the same as the lab sessions however, a good de-bugging skill is needed. The final project is most challenging and time consuming.

reviews.author: C-Yiu
reviews.comment_content: the course changed this year and the grade becomes worse than before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good, but only quite good. Not very impressive. A nice professor but he didn't tell me the things outside the slides.
reviews.comment_grading: Don't like the grading at all I'm sorry.I thought I can get A range but in fact, it ruined my dream.
reviews.comment_workload: normal. You don't have to do a lot and you just need to finish your project perfectly then you can get a good mark. But it quite depnds.

reviews.author: pca
reviews.title: easy course
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly about the electrical components, such as diodes, transistors etc. Most of the lectures and labs are helping you to build the car.
However, programming is needed to control the car, but not much is taught (only 3 lectures), most of the students with no knowledge of programming still don't know how to program the car. Self study is recommended...

Final project is to build a robot that could trace the line and avoid going to the wrong branches. Knowledge about state machine is recommended but it was not taught during the course.
There are 3 demo sections, 1 early demo and 2 final demos. I recommend taking the early demo as you can usually finish the car very early and the early demo give you 4 trials instead of 2 trials in the final demo.
There is also a mini-contest which could guarantee you an A if you got the first place. However, doing a round-trip is much harder than 1-way trip, you would need much more time tuning for that. Also, I saw some failed in the mini-contest due to various reasons... So better not rely on that to get an A. (only half of the ~40 registered teams went to the contest as most of them can't do it, and only 8 managed to do a perfect run.)
reviews.comment_teaching: There are pop-up quizzes during some lectures, so it is recommended to attend the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair. Full mark for labs, final project, lab midterm, 8/10 and 10/10 for quizzes, 93/100 for written midterm and got A+.

AFAIK most of the students got full marks in labs and final project. So, midterm and quizzes are really important for the grade.
They are easy, so you would need a really high mark for a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is low through out the course. Before the final project period, there is basically nothing to do, what you need to do is go to the labs. For the project period, you can basically manage to finish the car in 5 hours, so the workload is not high.
However, for the final project, please remember to check you car about 2 hours before your demo, probably it won't work when you check it and you need to fix it...
It is better to follow the suggested breadboard connection, so you could quickly figure out which wire is lost when you debug. Also, be careful in tuning the sensors, too sensitive would bring you harm during debugging...

reviews.author: 清香檸檬
reviews.title: Rather good grade. Easy course.
reviews.comment_content:
LECTURES & TUTORIALS
- Please refer to "TEACHING".

LABS:
Mandatory, six in total. 2 people working in a group. Find a friend to work together, else you will be matched with one.
The labs are easy. TAs are helpful as well. You shouldn't have any problem to get full mark here. Spending a little time reading through the lab notes beforehand is rather useful.

MIDTERMS:
There are lab midterm and written midterm.

Lab midterm:
You should learn how to use things like DSO and signal generator properly. Also remember not to mix up normal diode and Zener diode.

Written midterm:
Not quite difficult. You should get good results if you study well. Pay more attention to the parts about PNP and NPN, as well as the connection of ICs. Those questions are slightly harder.

PROJECT: (guide attached below)
Have to be done near the end of the semester. Your group (same as that of lab) have to construct an autonomous vehicle to move along the white line with curves and splits. You really have to spend some time on it, like testing Arduino codes. Around 4 to 5 days in lab is enough.  Enjoy the art of debugging your vehicle!

Demo, interview and report required for the project. Take the early demo if you can finish the car early.

Early Demo: testing x2, trial x4
Normal Demo: testing x1, trial x2

MINI-CONTEST:
Optional. Complete a round-trip of the project map as quick as possible. Winning group members will be guaranteed getting an A. My line sensors are not working well in a contest so I didn't get any prize. There will be prizes for top 10 groups, ranging from trophies to society paper. The fastest group finished in 39 seconds (round-trip), whereas 35 seconds is the time limit of getting full mark for project demo (one-way). Pretty hard to win the contest. Don't try to rely on the contest to get A. But if you can do so, you can simply ignore everything else.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The choice of instructor does not matter a lot. I don't really pay attention to what he said in class. His accents are a little bit weird but still able get what he is saying. He just simply read those powerpoints with slightly more explanations, which is rather mundane. Reading notes yourself is enough to get a good grade.

LECTURES:
There will be pop-up quizzes in lectures. Attendance of lectures is encouraged. Content-wise: For the first few weeks, those are only DSE Physics basic stuff, like dealing with circuits and resistors. Pretty easy. Don't really have to listen if you have DSE physics background. For the next few weeks, something new is taught, but pretty easy to understand. I think reading lecture notes by yourself is okay as well.

Topics mainly include:
  Energy, power source,
  pulse generation, PWM control,
  transistors, H-bridge, sensors,
  logics, K-map, sequential logics,
  Arduino & programming language

TUTORIALS:
They are not important. I almost skipped all.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite Good.
         Percentage    [My score]
Labs: 24% (@4%)    [20/20 for all labs]
Pop-up quizzes: 6%   [10/10 , 9/10 respectively]
Lab midterm: 15%   [14/15]; mean = 10.7
Written midterm: 20%  [84/100]; mean = 80.2
Final project: 35% [35/35]
  **the final project includes:
   (a) 25 marks demo
   (b) 5 marks interview after demo
   (c) 5 marks report
No final exam.
My final grade: 95.5% => A

p.s. I heard that someone got 93.x in total but finally got B+. Probably the grading scale is kind of narrow. Make sure you get high marks from every lab and quiz. A little can matter a lot.
reviews.comment_workload:
Before the project period:
Very low. Just don't forget to attend the lecture and labs. Nothing else have to do.

Project period (mid to late Nov):
Medium. You really have to spend some time to work on the car. Staying at the lab for 4-5 days, and 3-4 hours per day is pretty much enough. Having a responsible lab-mate is kind of important. However, I still see some groups that have to stay in the lab overnight.

reviews.author: Tony8981
reviews.comment_content: basic logic gate, timer and build a smart car
reviews.comment_teaching: didn't attend lectures, but the TAs in the lab were very helpful. you can ask them to build the circuit for you haha.
reviews.comment_grading: if you spend more time on your car, you will get a good grade, although I think the midterm was hard for me
reviews.comment_workload: all the workload is the car, you need to design half of the logic by yourself and normally you need to debug. in this stage, TA cannot help you so much, you need to handle those problems by yourself.

reviews.author: Hkustlai
reviews.title: Good Grade
reviews.comment_content: Teaching the basic theory of ECE like binary numbers, analog digital signal, circuit, logic gates.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lesson and tutorial is useful but need to pay more attention if someone is new to ECE. Lab is a bit challenging with hands on experience. The final project will need to make a car that follow the track automatically. It’s interesting. But the component is fragile and need to debug so many times!
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair but not a good grade course. Concept must be very clear in order to get high mark in midterm and finish the whole project.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is a bit heavy as there is final project which need to spend more time

reviews.author: Pacozer0
reviews.title: Beware of your labmates
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to ECE, talk about KCL, KVL and some basic electronics before the midterm. After midterm, It is about logic gates to build robots for the final project.
All materials are important if you want to get into ECE major.
The contents are very easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Song is a kind person. He leads students to think more about engineering and the way to study. His lecture is funny and the content is very good.
The lab is easy and funny and the TAs are also very kind to us.
reviews.comment_grading: You will receive a nice grade if you study hard for the midterm and find a hard-working labmate. Find a good labmate from the robotics team. Never find someone who doesn't go to the lesson and just sit next to you and do nothing during the final project.
reviews.comment_workload:
Just study hard for midterm and work happily with your labmate if he is not tan pi/2.
Building the robot may be tiring when debugging, but it is exciting.  Sometimes the IC maybe broke and make you frustrated but the TAs are helpful.

reviews.author: hchoag
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty easy, straightforward content so far.
Currently learning about basic contents about electricity.
The aim of the course is to build a robot car that can complete a given route.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is very good at teaching. He explains things very clearly, and I can see he is really enthusiastic about teaching. At the end of every lesson, there were always students eager to ask questions, and he would answer and explain with passion.
reviews.comment_grading: You will be guaranteed an A if you win the mini-contest with the robot car you built and programmed.
reviews.comment_workload: I don't know yet. So far I have been just reviewing the lecture notes in my own time. No homework yet. Maybe more workload will come when we start our labs.

reviews.author: Jack1995
reviews.comment_content:
Learn some basic concept of Electronic engineering
Teach basic circuit calculation and logic gate
In the Lab section, just need to build a robot car
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture is optional
For better understanding and following on the lab progress, attend tutor section is recommend.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade, almost everyone got a B or above.
If you can demo your car works perfectly.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too many, more on concept than large amount of notes/materials.
The largest workload is your final project - the robot car
If you get source, your life is easy, even the robot car you can just learn from other team.

reviews.author: Janan
reviews.comment_content:
the basic content is not very difficult.
the most difficult part is to figure out the whole circuit for the car by using the basic content.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is very funny and teach clearly
reviews.comment_grading:
mid-term is the most important part because most of the groups got very high or even full marks in the final project.( especially for the lab midterm)
There will have some sudden quiz
reviews.comment_workload:
You need to spend a lot of time to complete the car for the final project
Those Lab report have a very less workload since it will be done in the lab, you can ask the TAs to help if you got a trouble when doing the lab.

reviews.author: 起航
reviews.title: Good grading, medium workload
reviews.comment_content:
Basic concept of Electronic engineering
Lab 好有趣，多嘢玩
midterm分lab 同 paper
Lab 重要過paper.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is good if you attend all lessons and finish the project. Project may be difficult.
It's not only for ece student, so its won't be very difficult.
Midterm (paper) <mean 1sd
Midterm(Lab)>mean 1sd
Project almost full marks
Final grade : A-
reviews.comment_workload:
6 HWs
4 Labs

if you get source, HW are easy.
if you get souce, Lab are easy too.

Project may need a lot of time. Remember to do it as early as you can.

reviews.author: Kevinctk
reviews.title: Good course in year 1
reviews.comment_content: This course covers content from basic electronic rules(v=ir), and basic electronic components (capacitors,regulators) and ICs(counters, logic gate, d flip flop). At the end , you have to make use of these knowledge to make a robotic-car which is able to follow the track.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor explain these contents in a simple way, making knowledge easier to understand. TAs are willing to provide help to students during the lab section. After lectures, professors are  willing to answer student's question if they have any questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite fair . Although i did not make a good try in the robotic- car trial, I got a B+ at last.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is really small .Just take the lecture is fine. However, in the project period, you have to make your robotic-car. While in your project, you will find a lot of bugs , and you may have to use lots of time to fix those bugs. It is not difficult to find students after 12am in the lab.

reviews.author: HoiYiu
reviews.comment_content:
L01: Course Introduction and Basic Electronics
L02: Basic Electronic Components
L03: Power Consumption and Delivery System
L04: AC Power Sources and Rectifiers
L05: DC Power Sources and Regulation
L06: IC and Pulse Generation
L07: PWM Motor Control
L08: Transistor and Diode Circuits
L09: Motor Control by Transistor and H-bridge
L10: Kirchhoff’s Laws (1)
L11: Kirchhoff’s Laws (2)
L12: Sensor
L13: Midterm Review
L14: Binary Number and Logic Gates
L15: Boolean Algebra and K-Map
L16: K-Map and Adders
L17: Multi-bit Adder and Comparator
L18: Sequential Logics and RS Flip Flop
L19: Timing Diagram and D-Flip Flop
L20: Finite State Machine
L21: Finite State Machine Example
reviews.comment_teaching: 如果你本身有Background嘅話上堂都幾悶吓, 不過有時會有Pop-up Quiz焗你一定要去上堂, Johnny教書算係講得幾清晰
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz (8%):
- Pop-up Quiz (open book)
Labs (22%):
- 7個Lab, 頭6個3%, 最後一個4% (2個鐘內做晒有Bonus)
Exams (35%):
- Written Midterm (20%); Lab Midterm (15%)
Project (35%):
- Project Demo (25%); Post-demo Interview (5%); Project Report (5%)
reviews.comment_workload: 做Project嗰段時間會撞正考試, 所以會好辛苦同好大壓力, 預咗要係咁Debug同埋喺Lab通頂

reviews.author: calbeekid
reviews.title: 都算值得讀
reviews.comment_content:
其實可以分做兩部分
第一部分係學普通電，計下power，amplifier果啲，好簡單。過左written mid term exam就可以還返俾阿蛇，唔記得曬佢。 第二部分就重要啲，學logic gate，gate嘅構造，點砌logic先做到某啲功能咁。建議要上堂，睇ppt會難明啲。要學識曬先會識砌架車。
reviews.comment_teaching:
教lecture果個阿sir教得好好，一黎佢解釋啲concept果陣會用貼地比喻好易明，另一方面佢好俾心機令課堂變得有趣。
Tut就冇上過，次次九點半都起唔到身。佢主要只係教你下個lab點做，個ppt會upload上cavas，如果你唔係有啲乜問題想問就冇乜必要上。
Lab輕鬆，唔洗用腦照跟tut ppt就得。你做到爆曬炸嘅時候仲可以扮問lab assistant，佢會做埋你果份。
reviews.comment_grading:
我唔係好記得個weighting,可以睇返其他post check check, 同各位fm講聲sorry先。
  lab mid term 5/15, ~ below 1sd 
written mid term ~above 1sd 
車 15/25 
interview full mark
 report full mark
 pop up quiz 18/30  
Grade B- 最主要都係衰左架車
reviews.comment_workload: 好多人都話個course輕鬆，我就覺得麻麻啦。一黎有lab midterm同written midterm都要溫書，內容多有排妹，天才波較難。二黎架車最後要點砌係唔會講，要食腦。如果你/你groupmate叫做聰明少少，對logic有天分嘅都尚算ok，兩個傻仔(好似我同個frd咁)連普通logic都logic到hang機嘅就真係做到死。做左成個星期都debug唔曬，個Y split真係好攞命，到你做你就明，通常架車都會停係度震。其實好多人係架車度都唔會拎到滿分，mean大約係廿分啦，唔洗咁擔心。最後tips，千奇唔好最後果晚先通頂做，我驚你架車連向前行都唔識。

reviews.author: Cici Ho
reviews.title: Worth it
reviews.comment_content: The content is easy enough for beginners. You can choose this course even you have no any related knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Song explains very well and it is never boring to attend his lesson. Overall the TAs and STAs are really helpful.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is good. Although my midterm and final is just about or below mean, the final project saved me (perfect run), I got B+ at last, which is not bad since I didn't really pay effort.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not really big if you have a great lab partner to complete the final project. There is no regular assignment and the lab takes few minutes to read through.

reviews.author: ilovemywifi
reviews.comment_content:
成個課程其實都係圍繞係砌個架車所用到嘅野係咩。
最基本嘅有Analog and digital circuit, truth table, k-map, KCL&KVL等等。
仲會教你點樣用Sensor/controller去控制架車點郁。
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture我都冇乜點去上覺得冇用，但佢個quiz係pop up quiz所以最好收下風咩堂要上，千奇唔好走晒。

Tutor最好去上下，因為會講好多關於Lab會用到嘅野，所以tutor最好就唔好。雖然兩個都係內地教授但都睇得出佢地幾比心機教。

總結：想學多啲野嘅想攞A就去上埋Lecture，如果求B／C上tutor都夠做。
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab(once per week): 22%
Quiz(total 3): 8%
Midterm exam(written): 20%
Lab-Midterm: 15%
Final Project: 35%

我兩份midterm炒咗(below mean)最後個project demo無事完成都有B。
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload對於第一sem讀嚟講算係幾chur，因為都係屬於接觸啲完全新嘅野，每個星期嘅LAB都需要時間準備同埋摸索。

同埋最後個final project唔可以拖到太耐先做，如果做到最後先發現有問題而無時間補救就真係冇人幫到你。（真係要預極大機會要total通幾晚先做得完，debug都有排。）

reviews.author: MakFF
reviews.title: Final Grade: B+ (others good grade course != yours, pls choose courses regarding your talent and passion
reviews.comment_content:
ELEC1100 is designed to provide the fundamental knowledge on the basic electrical engineering, components design and skills
needed for the design, implementation and evaluation of a robot and its subsystems.
It will cover the basic electronic engineering principle and techniques.
Hands-on laboratory sessions, complemented with lectures and tutorials, are provided to allow students to have a systematic view
of the electronic engineering principles.
Students will have to apply the knowledge and principles learnt to design and build a functional robot by themselves.

Before mid-term, simple to moderate calculation, so concepts on physical like resistance, current and voltage and semi-conduction are required
Well, things got quite abstract after the mid-term.
reviews.comment_teaching:
SONG was like a father, he was keen on sharing his care and vision on university education. inspiring lectures.

BUT, as for the tutorials. Damn the ta's accent is way to heavy. I barely heard anything. It was difficult to focus.

ANDDD ultimately i would prefer spending my time on learning arduino than ICs circuit, although admittedly this course is a foundation of the path of any electronic knowledge.
reviews.comment_grading:
For whom only care abt the grade of their final project, should focus on k-maps construction, function and implementation of ICs(includes those did't mention in class, e.g. multiplexer) and how to use DFF. Done! Better self-learn then follow the class after mid-term, especially the working principle of ICs, it was kind of waste of time to figure out what was going on regarding earning a good grade.

While written mid-term was comparably require less effort then the final project. Just get used to the questions by studying the examples in every ppt and past paper.

For lab midterm, be aware of the usage of multi-meter along side with circuit construction(particularly resistor network construction). Pretty depends on luck, like final demo.

Quite good grade.
The most useful part of this review:
3 in-class quizzes: 6.9333% ((10+6+10)/30) (mean:7.1+6.1+7.7)
Lab: 22%(pls strive to get full marks in this section)
written midterm: 18.8% (94/100)(mean:62.4)
lab midterm: 11% (11/15)(mean:8.3/15)
demo: 14% (mean: 19.1/25)
interview:5%
report:5%
total: 82.733% (Grade: B+)

So, f*cked at the final demo can kill your grade. I am weak on handcrafting. So please struggle to find a seemingly nerdy lab-mate (pls don't find a friend of yours to be your lab-mate, substantially if you know he/she sucks academically.)

Grading is so damn good despite of my failure in my demo.
reviews.comment_workload:
You see, we screwed up in the demo. Yet, frankly, we spent 2 overnights along side with countless day time hours to fix the problem on y-splits. Because we knew nothing abt dff, we basically f*cked.
You paid but not necessarily gain.
START the final project as soon as possible. The lab always welcomes you.

And for those who did't build the car by themselves,
CURSE YOU MOTHER F*CKER
凸(｀0´)凸

reviews.author: Asuka
reviews.title: ELEC 1100
reviews.comment_content: teaching about analog and digital circuit. Also, something that related to robotic(like sensor,ac power, dc power, controller, mechanical motion) It's pretty easy for me. The Lab is so helpful for learning because the lab already teach you everything you need to know for your final project. The final project is to build a functional robot car and write a report about your car. They will give you about 2 weeks to finish your car. During those 2 weeks, the lab is open 24hours. The test for your robot car is not that difficult but the final project is count for 35%, so please pay more attention at your robot.
reviews.comment_teaching: skip a lot lesson so I don't know
reviews.comment_grading:
good grading

all labs almost full mark. in class quiz almost full mark.
midterm exam and lab-midterm exam below mean like 2SD
final project almost full mark

finally get a B+
reviews.comment_workload:
one lab per week(22% in total, all labs count)
have 3 in class quiz (8% in total)
one midterm exam(20%)
one lab-midterm exam(15%)
one final project(35%)

No final exam
No homework

reviews.author: Zeon Turing
reviews.title: good course
reviews.comment_content:
Electronics introductory
電子入門

-diode
-555 timers,counter, comparator
-regulator
-KVL,KCL
-transistor
-H bridge
-logic gates
-flip flop
-k map
-Finite state machine
-final project-build a car following the track

Overall content is not hard, but some topic can be very difficult and need luck on the final project
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good Professor. He encouraged student to ask questions and answer clearly. The teaching is clear.

Teaching of TA is also good, except her accent is quite hard to understand. But it is ok if you pay attention. She is willing to help students.
reviews.comment_grading:
random in-lecture quiz
lab
lab midterm
written midterm
final project
(forget the weighting...)
My result:
~80% quiz
full mark in lab mid term
full mark in lab
7x mark in written midterm mean is 69.x sd ~20
full mark in final project
92% A grade

我個midterm因為唔識做條KVL同比條diode 啲notation伏咗 (佢寫vin 同 vout 但我唔get點解嗰度係in 同out) 冇咗廿幾分 diode嗰度睇返ans其實唔難 係當時唔明佢想點 但KVL完全唔識計 有三個loop 冇可能V=IR計到 上堂嘅example冇咁複雜 其他部分有温書就識

lab mt都唔難 只要識駁circuit就得

lab就基本上滿分 2hr內做完有3分bonus(有嘅話要滿分最多扣3分)

final project要砌車 正路係用logic gate 同flip flop 但自己search下識用mutiplxer個circuit會易好多同易debug 最好verify啲sensor work 唔work先
同埋架車有個伏位 留返俾你地自己發現啦 睇下架車轉彎嗰陣就會知咩事
reviews.comment_workload:
very light, except the final project. 啲logic唔難 debug嗰陣最耐 可用kmap solver同circuit simylator幫手 架車要睇運 啲frd都係最尾demo嗰陣炒咗

當時砌咗幾日 total大約24hrs 架車嘅設計限制咗sensor擺位 卡咗好耐先揾到個位裝靚佢地

reviews.author: thwongba
reviews.comment_content: Very useful, taught about PWM and general circuit design, great introduction to electrical engineering and can tell whether you want to pursue EE in the future
reviews.comment_teaching: Absolutely magnificent, Prof. Murch is a really nice person, constantly asking us to raise questions about the content and prepared well for each lecture
reviews.comment_grading: Easy grading, 3 in class open book quizzes, 1 lab and written midterm, one final demonstration, and no final. As long as you get a full success final demo you have a range
reviews.comment_workload: It's okay, albeit very important that you understand the lectures and prepare well for the weekly lab session, or else it will be difficult to keep up in the latter stages and get the bonus point for the lab

reviews.author: Alois
reviews.title: fun and good grade
reviews.comment_content: Mainly how to build a robot car, including some basic knowledge about logic circuit.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think the teaching in lecture is quite good but it's very easy to fall asleep since the lecturer sometimes taught too slow. However you have to listen to him carefully for sometime he speed up really quickly, covering many content in just a few minutes.
TANG, Yimeng is a TA in the lab. She's really an expert in debugging , solving any circuit problems within just a few seconds.
The tutorial is amazing, everything in it is very important in both labs and midterms, the teaching is great. Comparing to the lectures, I learn more on tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading:
Exams: 1 written (20%) and lab (15%) mid-term; no final exam
Quiz: a few pop-up in-class quizzes (open book) (8% total)
Labs: 7 lab assignments (22% total, first 6 labs 3% each, final lab 4%);
minimum 4 labs’ attendance to be eligible for final project demo(Go to the lab on time (Bonus mark will be given for finishing the lab within2 hours))
Final project (35% total): Project Demo (25%), Post-demo
Interview (5%), Project Report (5%)


very good grade

got full marks in Labs
above mean in pop out quiz
1sd above mean in written midterm
1sd above mean in lab midterm
full mark in final demo
finally got A+
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the workload of this course is acceptable for a 4 credits course.
Me myself didn't spent lots of time after class.
About 10 minutes preview of the Lab is needed in order to get good grades in Lab.
Review about 1 day for written and lab midterm is ok as long as you goto the lecture and tutorials.
The final projects requires quite some time, I worked on my project for more than 20 hours.

reviews.author: D-Luffy
reviews.title: elec
reviews.comment_content: students can understand basic logic design of electronics. Using different logic gate such as AND, OR or Flip-flops to build a robot car that can follow a required track. While no programming is required, the logic design should be the most important part. It is fun since learn through such a practical way.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. SONG is a very nice person that will not only teach knowledge about the course. He is also a good mentor to many students. In lecture, his teaching is interesting and his speech can draw students' attention. He can raise students' interest in electronics.

Off the class, students are always welcome to meet him to talk about any issue of their university life. He always gives good advice and opinion.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is good. It depends a lot on the car project. If a perfect run can be done, it is almost an A.

At that time, I failed terribly in mid-term. But I got a perfect run and finally got a B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not so heavy, unless u are stuck in the project and cannot figure out the error. The last few labs before the Demo will be more challenging.

If you do not underestimate the midterm and talk more to STUDENT HELPERS, the course is pretty easy.

reviews.author: 刘秉琨
reviews.title: good course
reviews.comment_content: this course is very easy to learn. though there are lots of new concepts, they are easy to understand and remember.
reviews.comment_teaching: the professor is nice and TA will be happy to help you with your problems in tutor and lab.
reviews.comment_grading: if you devote enough time to this course, I think that you will be able to get an A or above.
reviews.comment_workload: the project is really fun and attractive. the only problem is that the many of the componets provided in lad are broken so it's very annoying.

reviews.author: FiFiW
reviews.title: Good Grade
reviews.comment_content:
Learn things like logic gates and transistors and other electronic components. Not difficult.

But the project is truly a pain in the ass, cause it will take way too much time debugging it.

Most of the time, even though your logic and circuits are perfect, the mechanical problem causes you endless failed trails.

Check your breadboard or use your own breadboard. Check every components and make sure they are working.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is good.
TAs are nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
B+
with successful final demo.
at around 80% you can get a B range.
It is important to carry each other.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is light until the final project period begins.
1 Lab midterm
1 Final written exam (Super easy)
build a car (most pf the time wasted on debugging mechanical problems while facing NOT EVEN ONE ELECTRONIC BUG)
And a easy report

reviews.author: JarvisTse
reviews.comment_content: 課程唔算難，lecture notes整得幾好，幾易明。Lecture同Tutorial唔計attendance，但有三個quiz會喺Lecture突擊open notes考。而lab最好上齊，因為每份lab都計分，同埋會一堂都其實係慢慢一步步咁教你點樣去完成個project。project佔分極重，係要你整架車，然後架車要自己識郁，識自動跟住條白線行，仲要識處理分岔口。基本上個project完美咁完成的話，其它分再差都好都應該會有B。而mid-term有分lab同written test。所以一定要上lab玩熟的儀器，如果唔係lab mid-term會出事，而written test考核範圈都幾少。
reviews.comment_teaching: 啲老師都幾用心教，lab嘅ta都幫咗唔少忙。
reviews.comment_grading: 呢科都公認係幾好grade。其實搞得到個project就可以安心收靚grade。如果mid-term生生性性有溫書嘅話，呢科拎A range絕對唔難。
reviews.comment_workload:
呢科wordload極細，得幾樣嘢要做。
1. 上齊lab
2. 佔分極細嘅open notes quiz
3. lab mid-term
4. written mid-term
5. project

建議提早做project，架車會因為好多唔關你事嘅因素而唔知做乜會唔得。大部分組都其實logic冇錯，車都冇砌錯。但因為零件太殘舊，壞壞地、個地圖俾人踩黑咗、sensor壞、sensor擺錯位、架車嘅滾輪生鏽等等唔關你事嘅因素而行唔到。所以好考你耐性同對自己嘅信心。如果順利的話可以3個鐘做完，但如果唔好彩嘅話有排你debug，一個禮拜走唔甩。

reviews.author: Cert
reviews.title: Good course if you have a good groupmate
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to electronic engineering. The course introduces different electronic components like diode and transistors, and some knowledge about logics used in electronics (Binary, flip-flop etc.). Although they don't require you to know everything in detail, sometimes things are not easy to understand.

Components and circuit structures introduced would be used to build an electro-robot (an electronic car). The car needs to go through a given track by itself (using given components and your design of the circuit). They provide you all the materials you need.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. FAN is passionate in his teaching. He is a professor from Mainland China but his English is easy to understand. He is also willing to answer your questions. He would try to know whether the students understand the contents.

The female TA (I forget her name...) is worse. She can't explain things clearly. I tried to focus on her teaching but I just couldn't understand. It's hard to explain but she is not as good as Prof. FAN in explaining the ideas.

In labs you may seek help from TAs if you have questions. They are quite helpful. When something doesn't work and you have no idea why, they are usually willing to spend time helping you to find out.
reviews.comment_grading:
I have forgotten the break-down percentages of the final grade. Please try to look for it in other reviews if you wish to know.

Things in written mid-term was quite hard to me (maybe I'm just bad T.T) . I got like 30-40%. In the lab mid-term I got slightly above mean.

Since I have a good groupmate and we both were willing to work on the project, we got full mark in everything in the final project.

Got B grade finally. It's not that harsh actually.
reviews.comment_workload:
It is a 4-credit course, so the workload is surely heavier than 3-credit courses, but not that terrible indeed once you have got used to labs.

One lab mid-term, one written mid-term, no final exam but a final project. No homework.

There are lectures, tutorials and lab sessions every week. A few sudden quizzes in lectures.
One lab per week. You need to form a group with one groupmate for all the lab work (can't be changed later). The tutorials introduce things you need to know for the coming lab (some of them actually overlap with things talked about in lectures).

Before mid-term, labs are experiments that let you get your hands on the components introduced and learn how to use the equipment.
After the mid-term exams, the circuit built in labs is for your final project (the car), and you keep progressing it in every lab.

A final written report needs to be submitted after the final project demo.

This course is a fun and unforgettable experience for me. Instead of just sitting in lectures, you really have a chance to build a robot from group-up and utilize the components you have learned about. Of course it would be quite painful if your groupmate is a free-rider. Better have a friend to study this course with you (REMEMBER: You two need to be in the same lab session).

reviews.author: haha1998
reviews.comment_content:

The TA,  Tang, Yiming, helps us a lot in the lab. Despite the poor accent, she is kind and nice to answer any question about the lab.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is pretty good. Take care of the written and lab midterm, and put some time on the final project, A+ can be earned easily. There are some pop up quiz in lecture but doesn't count a lot to the final grade. ~
reviews.comment_workload: The only workload is the final project. A little bit tricky but spending 1~2 nights is basically enough. You can even pay for a design. Just keep an eye on your battery, which makes an enormous different during your demo session.

reviews.author: Zori
reviews.title: The examinations lie on hard work, the project lies on destiny
reviews.comment_content:
In ELEC 1100, the final goal for every student is to design and build a car with given materials that can follow the white lines in the map and do different but right behavior under some rules when at the cross.
In the lecture, professor will give detailed explanations about the working functions behind the car step by step. Students are not required to fully understand the theory behind the functions while they need to be sure to know the logic in the function system and apply the functions well.
In the tutorial, TA will go through the lectures and do the groundwork for the coming lab, such as giving some examples of possible bugs.
In the lab, students need to follow the instructions to fulfill the tasks.

Speaking of the policy, there's no attendance requirement. However, concerning the pop-up quiz, absence may lead to the loss in grading.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The delivery and engagement of professor and TA is quite good, and both of them are really enthusiastic in answering students questions.
On the other hand, the teaching process is slow and somehow boring. Maybe the typical mainland accent should also be taken into account.
reviews.comment_grading:
Regarding of the distribution, 8% goes to the pop-up quiz, 22% in labs(Every lab roughly counts for 3% on average, bonus points will be given if student finish the lab within 2 hrs), 15% in lab midterm and 20% in written midterm, the final 35% goes to the project.
What impressed me most is the uncertainty in the project. Unexpected bugs occur frequently, some will even show up at the demo stage, leading to a severe failure in demo. The consequence is a severe failure in grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is pretty low before the project. Spending around 40 minutes to go through the lecture material is way more than enough to have a good handling of the class.
But note that in the final two weeks, many students will spend over 20 hrs to deal with the projects, some will even work overnight. But it really depends. I saw group spend less than 10 hrs to finish the job as everything went smoothly.

reviews.author: Q.C
reviews.title: A Cool Course
reviews.comment_content: At the beginning the contents of the course are very easy, most of which are high school physics like basic knowledge about circuits. But later there are new things like ICs, diodes, transistors, PWM control, KCL&KVL, logic design, DFF etc. fundamental stuff of electronic engineering, which is interesting and not hard to understand. However,the contents of lectures are not closely related to labs or tutorials.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good overall.
The professor is enthusiastic about electronic engineering and some of the students are quite engaged in his class. But sometimes his explanation is not clear and satisfying enough.
The TA is outstanding who excels at this subject and is always very kind and helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
It's easy to get a relative good grade, but not that easy to get an A+.
Most students can get almost full mark in labs (22%) and quizzes (8%), so it is the midterm score and final project that make a difference to your grade.
WM: (20%)  Easy (Max100, Mean69.5, SD21.9)
LM: (15%)  Better to divide the limited time wisely
Project: (35%)  including
1. Demo: (25%) Early demo is recommended
2. Post-demo interview: (5%) mainly to make sure each one in the group contributes. Questions are mainly about some specific parts of your design.
3. Report: (5%) About the details of your design and your experience with it.
reviews.comment_workload:
Small during the semester but large at the project period.
Before the period you basically don't need to do anything outside class but once it starts hours and hours are going to be spent in lab.

reviews.author: bagcal
reviews.title: One of the good courses
reviews.comment_content: The content covers, from most basic electronics (such as Ohm's law, power, current) to introductory logic. The scope of the course is pretty interesting and easy to keep up with and at the end of the course, you are expected to build a car which would be following a white line with your lab partner.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Fan Zhiyong was one of the best professors I've had this semester. He is pretty enthusiastic about the content, and he interacts with students well enough to know their names, which is pretty rare in the university environment. TA Yimeng Tang is also a  very good instructor, she was especially very helpful in the lab sessions, she definitely knows her subject well.
reviews.comment_grading:
-Written midterm 20%
-Lab midterm 15%
-pop quizzes 8%
-lab 22%
-car demo 25%
-post-demo interview 5%
-project report 5%

Most of the people I know managed to make the car work right so even though the project period is challenging, it is possible. I would say the most important aspect is the midterms, as long as you get a decent score in them, you should be getting a good score.
reviews.comment_workload:
Until the beginning of the project period, the workload is pretty light, the real struggle begins during the construction stage, which took me around 2 weeks.

Lectures are 50 mins long and require no preparation. Although attendance is not mandatory, given that there are occasional pop quizzes it is better to just attend them.

Tutorials give brief information about what is coming up in the lab sessions. I would recommend you to start attending them after the midterms when the lab content gets slightly more challenging before that just reading the slides without attending to the lectures should be enough.

The only preparation for the labs is prelab questions which are based on the tutorials and lectures. The take <10mis to solve.

reviews.author: Chunho0305
reviews.comment_content:
Like physics,  Then it'll start to get a little more in depth, talking about: transistors, KCL&KVL, PWM, truth map, K-Map and logic.Content builds on high school physics, and gives a neat introduction into concepts in electronics; in my opinion it is useful even if you are not required to take it. On top of all of these, this course is more practical-based, as Prof. Song put it: "Here, labs are more important than lectures; don't skip labs even if you skip lectures."

The Project Period in the latter part of the course gives you the freedom to design your very own logic to instruct a robotic car to complete a route (e.g. staying on track, choosing the correct branch to go, bouncing off at goal). For me it is the part of the course "you can learn most" because you are doing everything on your own. The lab opens 24h except when having labs for other courses, and the teaching team would help you with everything you need including consulting about your design. It requires textbook concepts, practical skills, debugging skills, teamwork, creativity; if not trains them.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Song explained things super clearly and interestingly.
reviews.comment_grading: Good Grade!
reviews.comment_workload:
Lectures are short (50 mins) and not mandatory, Prof. Song had hand-written notes all scanned online, plus powerpoint slides uploaded frequently to Canvas. To be frank you can skip lectures and manage your own time to cram materials, though not much needed to cram anyways. Tutorials are similar, but they are more directly useful in terms of helping you to complete the lab work efficiently. Midterms are not particularly difficult in terms of content, you need to be calm and revise to the point of understanding is enough, no need to do much exercise, but be sure you are familiar with the lab machines as you rely on them in the lab midterm.

Labs and Project
- How much you can score in labs and project depend largely on your use of time. There were quite some instances where students get frustrated when they cannot finish the labs on time for the bonus or even before the lab session ends, for me it was the lab midterm; and getting desperate when they find out not much time is left for the Demo to come. It is unwise to lose scores because of this, so all I can say is be careful
- Your time invested is proportional to your performance. (Some say you would sleep in the lab in the project period...)
- Raise questions when you encounter problems, so the best way is to be attentive enough to be able to raise questions.

reviews.author: daofu
reviews.comment_content: lecture是一些基本的电路知识，大半个学期上课学不到东西，但是有pop quiz，lecture你还是得去。大半个学期之后讲了一些逻辑电路方面的，之前没有学过觉得还是不错的，以及各种ic的用法。平时每周的lab还是需要好好准备一下的（0基础），所以主要都是从实际动手中学到东西
reviews.comment_teaching: 教授讲的特别特别耐心，很喜欢鼓励人，但同时就特别特别慢了。
reviews.comment_grading: grading很好但也有玄学，平时lab准备一下都是满分的。popquiz也是随便满分。但有个lab midterm，这个上面容易跪人，因为分发的IC可能有自身bug，运气不好会很费时间（我当初在最后几分钟改对了好几道题，所以也是很幸运了）还有written midterm，就像物理电路考试，难度稍有。最后就是final project了，这个也比较玄学，曾一度以为要靠运气，后来经过高人指点还是寻找到了很好的解决各类bug的方法，好处在你可以有很大量的时间来准备，坏处就是你可能要在实验室呆很长很长的时间，但也可以寻求帮助，最终拿到满分还是不难的。
reviews.comment_workload: 合在grading写了

reviews.author: Excalibur
reviews.comment_content: The contents generally involves some basic physics like ohm's law,KCL, and KVL, binary numbers and boolean operator and basic understanding about some ICs like H-bridge, comparator, and the most challenging in my opinion  D flip-flop.In addition, there are 7 labs that requires you to build the robot that can follow the white line for your final project and you need to be patient for debugging the circuits that you build.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is quite decent, so you may  skip some lectures. However, you need to take special attention that there are 3 pop-quizzes that will appear in the lecture. The tutorials may be helpful for you to understand more about the labs.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was quite fair enough. The written and lab midterm's  mean and standard deviation are 69.5/21.9 and 9.8/4.3 respectively. The labs is  also easy enough to get full marks and bonus (3 points and each lab has 30 as maximum point except the last one which is 40). Final project is consists of three parts, Demo, interview (to prevent free-pass), and report. I got full score in both quiz and final project and A+ was my grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is light enough so you don't need to study so hard. This course is easy A for 4 credits worth so make sure that you have a good partner that can be associate with for your labs and projects.
One last thing to note, SENSOR debugging is very annoying and I almost lose half of my project mark because of this.

reviews.author: Pratham
reviews.comment_content: Teaches first about the circuit used to drive the motor, which includes components like counter, comparator, timer, switch and Hbridge. Very interesting content if you take the effort to understand it.

reviews.comment_grading:
Full in all labs.
Missed 2 quizes
5/15 lab midterm
Finals and written midterm remaining
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload. Labs every week which are doable. Will be comfortable if you complete final project on time instead of procrastinating.

reviews.author: Anshuman
reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment_content: The course aims at teaching you how to create robot car. Interesting but too low level for me
reviews.comment_teaching: There are lectures,tutorials and lab sessions held each week. The tutorial was great way to recap the things you've learnt so far during class plus also get some extra notes about the topics. Also, it's pretty beneficial as is it helps you prepare for the up-coming lab assignments. But in our case, the lectures were lagging behind the tutorial sessions
reviews.comment_grading: There are in-class quizzes in the lecture sessions which account for about 8%. They will be held without notice so it's best to show up for the lectures. There's also the Lab work which accounts for about 22%, a written AND lab midterm which accounts for 20% and 15% respectively and finally the demo which holds 30% of the final grade along with a report which is 5%.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not that big. It gets bigger in the end though before the final demo, many people staying up all night on the few days before the actual demonstration. But other than that the workload is usually not that great

reviews.author: edwardo
reviews.comment_content: the course aim to provide knowledge building car follows a white line. It is not very useful but has a lot of fun
