I got the full marks on all labs and pop quizzes, almost one sd on written midterm, but about mean for lab midterm and final demo. Got a B+ in the end.... BEWARE OF THE SENSORS PLZZZZ the final demo went wrong cuz of sensors not of logics.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not that big. It gets bigger in the end though before the final demo, many people staying up all night on the few days before the actual demonstration. But other than that the workload is usually not that great

reviews.author: qwertyyuiop
reviews.title: DO TAKE THIS INTERESTING COURSE !
reviews.comment_content: The content is well-organized. It contains basic electronic knowledge as well as some basic logic. The last seveal classes will be challenging but very useful for the final project so pay much attention to them. There will be quizzes, midterm, lab midterm and a final project which can help to enhance the knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was very good, both the lecturres and tutorials. The instructor and TA teahes very well and demonstrate very good. It's very easy to follow the teaching content because the speed of lectures and tutorials was pretty satisfying. There was lots of instructions in labs as well and they are very happy to give some suggestions. However, the teaching lacks a little passion to attract students.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was very satisfying. It is very easy to get A+ if you spend  some time on it every week.
reviews.comment_workload: Most of the knowledge has been taught in high school for mainland students so it won't be hard to learn. And the lab is not hard for many students. The only possible workload is the final project which is buliding a robot car following the white track on the green map. If you spend two whole days in lab working on it, it will be not a great workload when the due comes near.

reviews.author: Richard
reviews.title: Elec 1100 is fun and Good Grade
reviews.comment_content: The content is good . And the project is fun . You need to learn the theory of practical theory . The lab require a group of two . If you can finish within two mins , then you can add marks.

reviews.comment_grading: This course has a Good grade!!!!! I got A grade from this course
reviews.comment_workload: You neeed to go to all lab . Each 3% . You can make-up .  There are three pop-up test

reviews.author: arya
reviews.comment_content: Very interesting. Nice as a starting point or fun side project. You have to build a line-following robot with pure circuitry, no embedded system programming.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof is very nice and helpful. On the nights before the deadline, he stayed till very late in the lab to help the teams.
reviews.comment_grading: Not bad, but everything depends on how the robot ultimately functions in the showcase, have to do a lot of trial-runs to be certain.

When you do it, it is a good idea to first design it and then record the connections somewhere, i.e. excel, and color code them. Otherwise with the sheer amount of wires you'll have on the board, it is near impossible to find anything under 5 mins.

reviews.author: LULLUL
reviews.title: Pay to win
reviews.comment_content: Teaches basic stuffs about circuits and logic. Can be considered fun if you are not too terrible at it. Easy labs and are quite interesting for freshmen to get some experience in handling electronic stuffs. Written mid-term and lab mid-term, with a final project building a car. Pretty cool. You can't miss out the labs, but the lectures are optional, except those with quiz.
reviews.comment_teaching: This course has many instructors, for lectures, labs and so on. SONG is a really great professor. Extremely friendly and helpful. Definitely an A+ for this. He is always at the lab, and reaches out to students. Cares about what you learn, cares about how you did, and most importantly cares about your grade :)
reviews.comment_grading: Pretty good grading here. Haven't heard anyone got a C, unless they basically missed everything. Mid-terms are not that hard, even if you are bad at written stuffs, the final project is what matters. And the main point of the course is, those cars for final projects are often built, or at least assisted by someone who have taken the course. As long as you pay a little, it is basically a free A range. Well, I was stupid and built that myself and got a B+, but yeah, still awfully good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Depends on how you plan to finish your final project. Buy: A for workload. DIY: E for this. Simple.

not extremely difficult things

good

reviews.author: helloitdog
reviews.title: Great Course, Great Prof, Great Grade
reviews.comment_content:
Building an electro-robot, with Navdroid and ICs.
Basics of electronics and EM are taught.
Topics:
Energy (AC/DC Power Source)
Pulse Generation/Pulse Wave Moderation (PWM)
Transistor
Kirchhoff's Voltage/Current Law

After the mid-term, the topics are related to the final car.
Logics/K-map
Sequential Logic
Flip Flops
Finite State Machines
reviews.comment_teaching:
Selected Prof. Shen's lecture. The lecture is a bit boring, yet essential to know what you are going to do in the final project. You can email/contact them if they want a chat about the car, or any ideas/obstacles that you think of. Prof. Song visits the lab periodically and you can ask questions meanwhile.

Dr. Tang is the IA of the course. She is responsible for the demos and lab sessions throughout the course. You can find her for administrative matters and such.
reviews.comment_grading:
You have no problem in getting A range if you successfully build a working car that can fulfill the requirements in the demo. You can choose whether to join the early demo that you have more time to fine tune (to be exact, 2hrs). You only have 15 mins(?) to finish the 2 trials with no return in the final demo. You can join either one, but NOT both.

Exams:
Written Midterm (20%)
Lab Midterm (15%)
No Final

Quiz: a few Pop-up In-class quizzes (open book) (8% total)

Labs: 7 Lab Assignments (22% total, first 6 labs 3% each, final lab 4%); minimum 4 labs’ attendance to be eligible for final project demo.

Project: Project Demo (25%), Post-demo Interview (5%), Project Report (5%)

You can easily get the whole project part if you did not freeride your partner (Please, don't do it in this course, the workload is HEAVY)

Get full marks for most labs, missed one quiz, mean for both mid-terms, full mark in project, overall: A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Mediocre/Heavy (C-):
Labs and PROJECT PERIOD (Majority of workload is in late semester)

The lecture materials are not hard to understand. If you have any questions, you can ask the Profs. The main part of the workload lies in later part of the semester, when you get hands-on experience in building the car. You get access to lab and make the car from scratch. A part of the car is already done in the 7 labs (The things you need to think and design are the directional/turning/speed settings, which build the brain of the car)

reviews.author: Tjtanaa
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is very fundamental. They are easy to learn. However, you have to spend a fair amount of time to think of the ways to apply them when you are building the robot. Personally thinking, the course content is very easy. If you really want to learn something and to find out whether you want to major in ECE, this isn't a suitable course to take. However, it is one of the required course to fulfill your major requirement thus it is a compulsory course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecturer isn't good in explaining due to low command of English. However, the TA is really good at explaining. Attending tutorial is a must as you are able to get the overview of the contents of the previous lecture and the hints to the lab tasks.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is small. There's no homework. There is only 3 to 4 mini quiz after lectures. The workload is fairly high during the last 2 weeks when you start to build the electronics circuit on your robot.

reviews.comment_grading: grade is good. written exams are easy and tests are easy too. Just be careful of mistakes.
reviews.comment_workload: there's no work load until the final project. If you can finish the final project fast enough, then there's no workload at all.

reviews.author: 李翔

reviews.author: Taipei frog
reviews.comment_content:
Useful and basic knowledge for students who want to have a taste of electronic engineering.  V=IR, AC DC power supply, logic gates, KCL,KVL......
Most of them are pretty basic.
reviews.comment_teaching: The TAs and Teachers teach well.  The powerpoint isn't too long and is simple and clear.  Somehow a little bit boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Your car works fine( achieve more than 25 out of 27), you get Brange.  You do good on midterm (higher than 1 sd) and your car works fine, you get A range. You do good on both of them and achieve more than 12 out of 15 in your Lab midterm, you get A+.
(All based on by default you get all points from lab)
reviews.comment_workload: Not a lot.  But still needs time to build the car.  Prepare for it earlier.

reviews.author: albertpare
reviews.title: ELEC 1100 Review
reviews.comment_content: Very Interesting content. Enjoyed it. I didn't have any basic knowledge at all about robots and I found the course very interesting and quite easy if you study well enough.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching style is a bit boring. The first few lectures are very easy, but towards the end, you need to concentrate during lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
A few surpise quizzes
Midterm
Final Demo
Post demo interview
Project report

Midterm 83%
Final Demo = Full Mark
Quiz = perfect except for the last quiz i skipped

Overall = A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Lab every week to build your robot for the Final Demo.
Labs are relatively easy.
No homeworks.
A few surprise quizzes that are easy.

reviews.author: 勖
reviews.comment_content: 整體簡單，期中之前讀PPT即可，最後幾節lecture和tutorial比較重要也會難一些，與project關係密切，可能要花一點時間理解
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof和tutor講課內容不錯，講的很細，但都會有口音不太好懂，像我這種聽不太懂得多是照著PPT學的……
reviews.comment_grading:
quiz8%  
lab22%
midterm20%
lab mid15%
final project35%
其中大部分都可以基本拿滿，只有lab mid不太容易，因為bug時間可能不夠，建議在平時lab上多練練，不要全指望partner
reviews.comment_workload:
無assignment，平時基本沒有workload，看PPT即可

reviews.author: mincheol
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite useful in your preparation for the elec major. Basicaly you can study about basic circuits, function of many electric devices such as diode and sensors and logic gates. At the end of semester, you gain the chance to design your own circuit with logic and build your own robot.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is quite hard to understand what the teacher is talking about. For my professor, his pronunciation became impediment in my understanding. I understood the lecture stuff by self study throughout the semester and it was tough semester for me.
reviews.comment_grading:
Final is about 35% including your project and report.
There are also 7 lab sessions throughout semester that is about 10% of your grade.
Written Midterm and Lab midterm is 15% and 20% each.
There are 3 quizzes in one semester that is about 10%.
The final project is basically building a robot car and make it run through the assigned path. If you can meet a smart lab partner and build a car with perfect run, then you could get A- or B+ for the course.
reviews.comment_workload: For me, the workload was quite heavy. Every week, I had to prepare for the lab sessions and get to know the lecture content due to quizzes. However, if you do not procrastinate what you need to do, I think work load is quite fair.

reviews.author: Raymond Leung
reviews.title: Ok
reviews.comment_content:
Through hands-on labs and term project, complemented with lectures
and tutorials, you will be able to:
Analyze and design simple analog circuits, combinatorial and sequential logic circuits, and design and implement simple feedback control strategies.
Build and debug real engineering system following a hierarchical design principle.
Work in a team environment: learn and practice effective project and time management.
Execute a complete project from problem formulation.
Problem with conventional teaching:
Current education system was developed in the industrial revolution and does not evolve to the information era
Teaching knowledge, but not how to apply the knowledge
School never tells students that the taught knowledge may become obsolete upon graduation design/implementation, up to verification and documentation.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab:22%
Quiz:8%
midterm:15%
lab exam:20%
Demo project, interview, lab report:35%
No final exam.
Labs will be easy as you can find a good partner.
Midterm is quite easy.
You can get full marks in the quizzes since it is open book.
You will at least a B range when you get a perfect fun in the demo project.
reviews.comment_workload:
You will do 7 labs in this course.
Three quizzes in the lecture.
You will have two weeks for the project period and you have 2trials to demo.
If you want to take an early demo, you can have 4 trials. But the time will be only one week.
Many people will stay in the lab room for a whole day during the project period.
Therefore, it is really a big workload.

reviews.author: Jost
reviews.comment_content: The course is basically for everyone, it's OK if you don't have a decent science background. The knowledge you need to build the final project, which is a robot car will be covered up in the lectures throughout the semester. They include big topics such as PWM control, transistor, H bridge, KCL/KVL, logics, kmap, and finite state machine, all of which are important parts for you to complete your robot car.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Song is a really cool and nice professor. He interacts quite actively with students in class and has been a great help especially when we were building up our cars. He speaks Mandarin, Cantonese and English all pretty well.
reviews.comment_grading:
-Two midterm exam: written (20%), lab(15%), no final exam.

- Labs: 7 lab assignments (22% total, first 6 labs 3% each, final lab 4%); minimum 4 labs’attendance to be eligible for final project demo

P.S. Go to the lab on time (Bonus mark will be given for finishing the lab within 2 hours)

-Final project (35% total): Project Demo (27%), Post-demo Interview (3%), Project Report (5%)

-Few pop up in-class quizzes(open book)(8% total).
reviews.comment_workload: No assignments after class. Only need to do assignments(lab report) in the lab session. It's a good idea to plan ahead to pre lab when you are not familiar with the content. The final project will take a considerable amount of time even a few all nighters.

reviews.author: Jason 0.0
reviews.title: Great and fun course!
reviews.comment_content: The content is easy. Prior physics knowledge comes in handy when dealing with mid-term written exam. There is a few (i.e. 2-3) in-class quiz throughout the course so skipping class might risk getting a 0 for a particular in-class quiz.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Song is very nice. He doesn't read off the powerpoint, interacts and explain the concepts in detail. During the final project period, he always comes by the lab to give students advice.
reviews.comment_grading:
Exams: 1 written (20%) and lab (15%) mid-term; no final exam

Quiz: a few pop-up in-class quizzes (open book) (8% total)

Labs: 7 lab assignments (22% total, first 6 labs 3% each, final lab 4%); minimum 4 labs’ attendance to be eligible for final project demo

Final project (35% total): Project Demo (27%), Post-demo Interview (3%), Project Report (5%)

Grading is fair and square.
reviews.comment_workload: Although there is no final exam but beware! The project can be a pain you leave it until the last minute. You might have to pull a few all-nighters to finish the car and it is not guaranteed that the car may work during the final demo.

reviews.author: Bearrr
reviews.title: 幾好玩 建議唔知讀咩就讀
reviews.comment_content:
小弟我就冇讀過phys 而且九點半堂 就全部走曬
咁最基本計A計V計電阻都唔識啦
但係唔緊要 要計數/識theory既只有written midterm

lab midterm就要砌3個唔同既circuit
一個circuit其實都係駁好一粒IC 但係時間都幾緊湊下
一亂左就會唔知做緊咩 所以lab一定要自己做

而lab呢 建議上lab之前睇下自己要砌d咩 起碼清楚你要砌落去既ic有咩用 同埋佢既output係點樣 方便你check bug

因為project啲野係based on lab 所以一定確保每個lab既野都係work同冇bug 而且知自己做緊d咩 check bug都易d

project其實要做到佢requirement拎滿分其實冇想像中難
做完lab7之後你架車就應該識向前行
睇下d logic gate既IC有咩用
諗下d sensors唔同情況既output就可以輕鬆做到

有bugs第一時間睇下有冇插錯
第二就係睇下ic d腳位個V正唔正常 d仆街IC真係成日壞 有d又甩曬色睇唔到咩黎
reviews.comment_teaching: 個prof好似幾好人 成日send email過黎鼓勵我地 lab/project period又成日去lab到睇下我地做成點 幾nice下
reviews.comment_grading:
lab有source理應滿分 bonus聽講係lab唔係滿分幫你補上去

上堂quiz miss左都可以係第二個session補返 有做就可以 open notes(check埋電話都冇人理你其實)我就柒 拎唔足曬8%

written mean 70% 我踩mean
lab midterm meam 8/15 定9/15 我就得10/15

今次project比分係27%車 40秒行perfect run就滿分 3%post demo interview 主要check下架車係咪你砌 會問你點解d sensors咁放 點樣設計佢行到個route個類 如果係自己做就輕鬆拎曬3%

5%final project跟佢指引就會滿分

overall 85%左右 B+
個個人lab同project仲有quiz都滿分 A range就睇兩個midterm 高0.5就大概A-
reviews.comment_workload:

最麻煩係個project唔知邊到有問題 要重新換logic design煩少少
我同我lab partner做左四五日左右先做完 前後換左三個design

reviews.author: 當科
reviews.title: 好course，推薦
reviews.comment_content:
4 in-class open book quizzes (輕鬆滿分，其實係攞嚟take attendance)
1 Lab/week (頭幾個係輕鬆，但之後最好每次都做prelab)
Written midterm (要操少少卷，唔難)
Lab midterm (難度較高，平時做lab要專心d)
Final project (都唔少人滿分/接近滿分) + report (report輕鬆滿分)

內容好有條理，由淺至深 (但係深極都唔難，話曬係introduction)。midterm前個人覺得KVL KCL小小複雜，加埋要記唔同IC既功能要話d時間，不過只要操一操pastpaper，written mid term都ok輕鬆。

midterm後開始教d logic，記住要認真聽。因為我個時以為唔洗再考試所以冇乜專心，不過之後project唔識做，到頭來都係要自己睇翻lecture notes。

project記住預早開始，因為一定會有好多你預期唔到既bug。同埋lab partner好重要。lab partner好重要。lab partner好重要。如果佢freeride你，你好大獲。記住代眼揀partner。
reviews.comment_teaching:
有得揀一定要揀professor song
上堂講野清晰，氣氛好，解釋concept仔細。
落堂得閒仲會去lab度睇學生，add佢facebook仲可以問問題，呢d其實唔係佢份外事。我都幾佩服佢咁比心機教書。
reviews.comment_grading: 屎忽痕打呢篇野既時候未派grade所以唔知。
reviews.comment_workload:
midterm前workload 3-3.5 cred
midterm後做project workload 4.5-5 cred

其實作為4cred course我覺得都可接受。而且chur完真係學到野。

reviews.author: desert_e
reviews.title: Really Good course.....must take for engineering aspirants
reviews.comment_content:
Contains 8-9 labs...which actually teaches everything for the final project demonstration. The tutorials are a must, since you get to know of the quizzes and way to work in the labs. Teaches the lab equipment handling skills. At last, the project is there which allows you to have a first hand experience of robotics, circuits etc.

One midterm...written
Labs are marked
3 quizzes (very easy for regular class participants)
reviews.comment_teaching: The lectures can get a bit boring, but the professor I got (Mr. Antonelli), was very friendly and helped me clear all my doubts. A special heads up for Yimeng, TANG. She helped me the most during the course and never hesitated to stay back during tutorial/labs to clear my doubts.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is very fair and accurate. You are graded according to your work. Point to point mark.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload can be extensive at times, particularly towards the project deadline, as you have to work to get it done. Be sure to keep your robot secured since I had mine destroyed days before the competition by some *insert the description here*. Course demands attention and for a good grade, have to work hard.

reviews.author: Alexyyyyy
reviews.comment_content: Content are simple, just basic physic, so everyone can be able to handle them.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof.Fan did a good job in teaching. Well I slept alot during the class but that wasn't his fault. He did put effort in it.
reviews.comment_grading:
You should have heard of it by now....
One of the best in term of grading.....
You should study the midterm exam because there are quite much of luck factor in the final project so it's safer to do as well as you can in midterm.
reviews.comment_workload: Final project can be harsh if you enter the lab in the last 3 days. If you give it time and effort it should be ok.

reviews.author: Q_Q
reviews.title: A Rewarding Course
reviews.comment_content: You could really learn a lot after taking this course. The best part of ELEC1100 is the lab,where you get a chance to apply the knowledge from lectures. If you have already learnt some basic Highschool knowledge in Physics about electric circuit, the content won't be hard at all to be honest.
reviews.comment_teaching:
For me, Prof.SIN's spoke too slowly that I often fell asleep. Or maybe because I was taking his 9AM class. But the nice thing about him is that he is always willing to answer questions, so just go and ask him!

By the way, another important thing is to ask the TA,who will be in charge of all the exams and the final project. Any time you have a question in your mind, just throw it to the TA. My TA was really helpful.
reviews.comment_grading: The grades are good(Premise:if you work hard enough) You can definitely get nearly all full marks in Written Midterm,Lab Midterm,Quiz and the Final Project. In my opinion, its just a matter of attitude. You will get your deserved grades as long as you really work hard on this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
As mentioned in the Grading section, the workload depends. If you want to get a good grade, you need to shed sweat and put time and effort into it.

Also you need to take the Labs seriously. Though you could count on your "almighty, super nerdy, all A+"groupmate, you will have to take the lab midterm on your own. At that time, you will realize whether you have truly learnt the skills or not.

reviews.author: DaiKIng.Q
reviews.title: 这个课还是值得一上
reviews.comment_content: space里这么多英文版的评论我就写一份中文版的satisfy一下大陆同学。这个课还是很不错的，作为一个introduction course，没有final考试，final P做一个小车，肯蹲实验室几天就好。不懂就问，有人负责好好解答你的问题。唯一的问题是大多数人（反正我就是）以前都没有接触过板子，所以插起电路来比较陌生，debug能力为零，面对bug比较慌。但反正要走出这一步，我今年的龟是A+（主要还是抱腿抱得好）。嗯，总之比较推荐这门课。另外space里也有我的联系方式，如果有什么further needs尽管联系我。
reviews.comment_teaching: SIN是不错的教授，他是local中英语非常够意思的，语速也慢，听懂没问题。也很关心学生，我一直跟他聊电子的发展方向（虽然最后的结果是我决定不报ECE了233）。上课没听懂的尽管问，讲到你懂。再说一下TA，我也不知道为什么带我们的TA基本都做gym，我老能遇见他们，所以混的熟，毕竟也是在ust读书的phD，最后final P还约了TA单独请教，总之这门课教学挺好的。
reviews.comment_grading: 给龟不错。不得不承认有特殊情况，我有朋友的车子最后demo的时候崩了，非常意外地烂龟了，不过据我所知大多数人还是不错的，所以我给了B。
reviews.comment_workload: 如果好好学，各个element都知道干嘛的，final project不是事儿。但如果最后突击的话，workload还是挺大的。起码与偶两个星期的时间，基本需要你天天晚上往实验室跑。不过工院的同志们，应该适应坐lab吧~

reviews.author: Marcos白佳欣
reviews.comment_content: 內容並不複雜，但是如果想的高分就要好好聽講，下課拿著筆記多想一想。lecture一開始的內容非常簡單，但是到期中以後從邏輯門開始的一些內容具有一定難度。tutorial是用來幫助你完成實驗課程的，雖然我沒去上過幾次，但是肯定有用，而且最後幾次很重要，關係到你的小車邏輯電路的設計。lecture和tutorial的最終目的都是為了final Project。
reviews.comment_teaching: 這門課只有第一節是課程上標記的老師講的，後面所有的lecture都是一個意大利小哥Marco上的。英語發音中有一種濃濃的意大利風情，反正我聽了好幾節課才能習慣並且聽懂。他講的非常細，而且會很耐心地解答同學們的問題。
reviews.comment_grading:
我們那個學期評分方式：quiz:10% labs:20%，written midterm：20%
lab midterm：15%  project：35%。
lab midterm是個考驗，前幾節lab一定要多動手，別全讓同學幫著做，要不然會跪。
對了，還有三個小quiz，會在lecture上出現，不會提前告知，會打你一個措手不及，所以不要翹課。
reviews.comment_workload: 我覺得workload是因人而異的。畢竟是工院的課，debug是永恆的旋律。final project的bug少，通過率高，自然就workload少。提別要提醒大家兩點：第一，給邏輯電路debug時，要測一下每個點的電壓，這樣很快就知道哪條線不對或者那個IC是壞的。第二，小車的邏輯電路設計特別重要，不要怎麼簡單怎麼來，複雜一點沒關係，到後來demo的時候就會順利很多！

reviews.author: President
reviews.title: Nice course
reviews.comment_content: These course will teach you the basics of electronics, and the skills and design of a basic robotics system(e.g. how to use sensors and the signal they produced to guide the robot). It is a enjoyable course as you will have chance to implement the knowledge you learn in classes and labs to the final project and build something real.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Song is a very knowledgeable and nice teacher, he will alway answer your questions and explain difficult topic very clearly. You will definitely enjoy his lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: Student usually will do pretty well in lab and quizzes(close to full marks), so if you need to get A range you have to do well in your robot project, midterm and final.
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment:
There are no assignments for this course.
Quiz:
There will be two or three quizzes for this course, but it will be very simple as you can even use your phone to search the answer on the net(officially).
Lab:
There will be a lab everyweek, so you need to read a lab manual and play around with the bread board once a week.
Project:
When it reaches the last three weeks of the course, you need to start working on the group project on building your line following car. These will be the most demanding weeks in the course so be prepare for it.

reviews.author: anis
reviews.title: A great introduction course ...
reviews.comment_content: Although different from a typical first electronics course, ELEC 1100 is almost fully designed for the aim of the final project. General notions in the beginning, then useful information for the project. The labs are well designed and relatively well structured.
reviews.comment_grading: The class is really competitive. Do not ignore the bonus in the labs, and work on time management before exams. As for the project, make sure to have a good logic. Don't trust the sensors !
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy, but enjoyable if you are/become interested in electronics. Prepare yourself for all-nights in the lab if you don't start with a good logic. Spend more time on the logic design ! Make sure to make one that relies the least on the sensors.

reviews.author: Jonas
reviews.title: what a good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
中學physics
transistor
KCL,KVL
PWM
Truth table
K-map
Logic
reviews.comment_teaching:
基本上係唔想上堂,notes寫得好詳細
tutorial 都係唔洗上,因為個TA英文好差
reviews.comment_grading:
quiz:8%
lab:22%
written mid term:20%
lab mid term: 15%
demo:30%
report:5%

total:90.2%
grade:A-
reviews.comment_workload:
每個星期都要做lab其實幾chur
架車大約2-3日就可以砌好
建議做完lab7就砌,因為sem 尾會忙到有咩時間

reviews.author: sgargaa
reviews.title: The course is really interesting
reviews.comment_content: The content was pretty chill in a way that yes, you learn new things, but no, they will not take you long to understand. It gets slightly nasty towards the end, when Finite State Machine is introduced.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching was fine. Professor was interactive and solved doubts even in between the class. However, the TA had an irritating accent.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is pretty fair, yet there is a lot to do to get marks.
Written midterm 20%
Lab midterm (15%)
Quiz: a few pop-up in-class quizzes (open book) 8% which makes attendance in classes compulsory in a way
Labs: 7 lab assignments (22% total, 3% for Labs 1-6, 4% for Labs 7) and minimum 6 weeks’ attendance to get a ticket for final project demo, also it is better to go through the labs before going to class
Going to your lab session on time may fetch you extra marks (Bonus mark will be given for finishing the lab within 2 hours)
Final project 35% total with 30% demo, 5% project report
reviews.comment_workload: There is a considerable amount of workload because if you do not prepare for your examinations, the mean goes high. Apart from that, in order to actually complete your project successfully, you need to be well-versed with the course content. Also, remember to get a decent and hard-working partner, else you will be in a fix.

reviews.author: Pang.
reviews.title: Oh well
reviews.comment_content:
一開始25% 基本中學level phy

之後果25% pwm, transistors, h-bridge, KCL, KVL
開始嚟料 不過都唔算太難。呢個亦係決定written midterm 咩grade嘅部份

最後嘅50% adder, flip flop, finite state machine
唔係咁容易明 不過亦唔需要明(晒全部) 原因後述
reviews.comment_teaching:
香港Prof
有d中學阿sir feel 冇乜特別話好定唔好 唯一好處係唔明落堂可以直接用廣東話問。
雖則我上親呢堂都覺眼瞓 不過呢一點同兩個lecture都係9點堂有莫大關係 :o(

TA 英文恐怖到一個點
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 8%
輕鬆滿分 你有去嘅話

Lab 22%
基本上滿分唔難，只係每份都有一個部分Theoretical question 可以上lab之前睇notes做定先，對攞bonus有幫助。

Written midterm 20%
出問題唔算多伏 攞高分唔難 時間尚算充足

Lab midterm 15%
滿分15分 做嘅嘢俾written簡單 但時間相對緊迫 所以做每一步要小心 唔好插錯位 / 攞錯resistor之類 要返轉頭做過嘅話好容易搞到做唔晒
1分1%呢種玩法就…的確有啲令人不安

Demo 30%
跟住白色線嚟行，會有三個分叉路 + 一大堆90度轉彎
基本上d task做晒並唔難，呢度佔咗 26%
問題係在於架robot成日去到某個位就會出錯
出錯後唔駛重新嚟過 可以擺係出錯嘅地方再試過
但係如果可以完美地行晒就有多 3% perfect run分
今次嘅mean就係 26.5/30 呢個分表達咗啲咩自己參透下~

(最後1% 係要係20秒內行晒 呢層就恕我無能為力 不過難做到明顯唔等於冇人做到)

Report 5%

附上小弟戰績以作參考
Quiz 8/8
Lab 212/220
Written MT 73/100 (mean 76) <-- 炒ed
Lab MT 13/15 (mean 8.74)
Demo 26/30 (mean 26.5)
Report 4/5
Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
1. To free riders
食屎啦你

2. To non free riders
呢科冇Final 亦代表Project越早做越好 少一科煩惱

每一個禮拜都有lab，基本上做嘅嘢唔難，但係好q煩。而且有Bonus分"鼓勵"你兩個鐘頭之內做完，基於我幾次都係孤軍作戰嘅關係，搏命都未必趕得切。所以事實證明揀啱groupmate係好重要架

隨機Quiz 係最hihi嘅地方之一 不過好在全部都係喺堂尾考 遲到都無事

不過冇final都有好處 就係mt以後基本唔駛聽書 做project嘅時候對住notes做就得
Demo攞滿分一定要用flip flop + 普通logic gate 除此之外就係 trial and error 試到得為止 :)
Debug到treegun就不在話下啦 尤其是對住堆19 sensor都咪話唔辛苦 在此小弟需再次強調 找一個好的groupmate是很重要的

總結而言 以1字頭course而言頗chur 不過同上堂以外精彩絕倫嘅"活力生活"比較 我覺得都算係咁…

reviews.author: jowos
reviews.comment_content:
這門課的LectureTimeslot是很靈活的。因為即使你reg進了一個堂你也可以隨時去另一個堂聽課。雖然課上會有突如其來的quiz，等同是attendance，但是你可以早上睡過一個quiz馬上下午到另一個堂上補回來，都是可以的。比如我這學期就是reg進了周一和周三的九點宋勝輝堂（畢竟這兩個堂選的人稍微少點，考慮到競爭會不那麽激烈）然後周三的九點堂常常睡過，於是就去補周五中午12點的施林堂。第一次quiz周三的睡過去了，星期五去補上了，毫無壓力。


然後課程內容簡單易懂，結合中學的電路知識可以很輕松地理解。


Lab很重要。畢竟是個ELEC課，重點全在動手。Lab是累積性的，也就是說之前Lab做好的基礎工程在之後會用到，每次Lab基本上都是在上一次的結果上疊加，所以一定要養成好習慣1.剪線盡量剛剛夠長度，導線盡量貼著底部，這樣就算後面的邏輯電路的線飛得到處都是也不至於和之前的基礎工程搞混2.IC盡量放得靠近些，節省空間，否則之後你會發現沒有地方放邏輯。。。


說說Project。其實我在開工之前請教了很多高人，他們的經驗對我影響不小。一開始我執著地相信他們的做法，從沒有懷疑過，所以走了很多彎路。然而最後發現就我的Project而言得改很多地方才能夠達到效果。果然自己的project還是得自己做，自己不斷嘗試，不斷debug，不斷總結才行。所以keepin mind兩點 1.不要只顧著求新求異，任何新異的設計都應該有實用性的理由支持，而不是全憑借想象設計2.得做好花時間的心理準備，不要妄圖一夜之間就做好，很多時候都是一個設計不行又改一個設計，很多出現的意外和不穩定性都得絞盡腦汁思考解決方案。刷夜不是必須的（我就沒刷過），但是你得把整個做project的period放長，因為很多時候一個新問題暴露出來你往往不能在在lab的幾個小時之內參透並且解決，反而是回hall睡一覺起來甚至洗澡的時候突然想通。。。所以每次去Lab不一定要刷夜打持久戰，我覺得先想好一個idea之後，去到lab集中幾個小時實現這個idea之後test幾圈debug一下就可以回去了，隔天再來就好。個人認為效率高於刷夜。OwO
reviews.comment_teaching: 宋勝輝喜歡手寫白板，講得好，規規矩矩，深入淺出，不緊不慢。施林給人感覺有點基。。。。施林在每個lecture會做一個SHILecture講人生，還挺有意思的。施林比宋勝輝愛開玩笑一點，但是有時候會冷場。。。。然後施林有點強迫癥，下面有人講話他一定會停下來，不說話，望著下面，等人都閉嘴才繼續。宋勝輝常常出現在Lab，很平易近人的一個人，我還在lab裏晚上10點左右跟他探討如何設計RC延時電路的問題，雖然最後因為找到替代方案而且實驗室裏面沒有PNP三極管（因為他們設計的lab不用所以沒有買過QwQ）所以沒有做。我還是更愛宋勝輝一些OwO，所以最後都只去他的堂了，雖然是9點堂QwQ。

reviews.author: cmyan
reviews.title: ELEC 1100
reviews.comment_content: 頭幾堂係學番啲好基本嘅電路野,例如current, voltage, resistance. 跟住就教唔同嘅IC(integrated circuit), Kirchhoff's circuit law, logic gate, transistor, PWM, etc...
reviews.comment_teaching: 個Prof係外國人黎, 英文順暢, 教得好詳細, 不時舉例子同比喻容易理解.
reviews.comment_grading:
7個Lab: 22%
3個quiz計最高分嗰兩個: 8%
Written Midterm: 20%
Lab Midterm: 15%
Project Demo: 30%
Project Report: 5%
我係全部midterm踩 mean, demo 滿分, A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
要做7個LAB, 完LAB 都要交份LAB Report, 如果可以係兩個鐘內做個LAB 有Bonus分加. 啲LAB都算易做 跟足晒guideline就做到.

有midterm但無final, 所以midterm之後無上過堂.

Project demo 主要都係較下sensors, 啱位置就會perfect run.

整體黎講都算輕鬆嘅, 最少無FINAL.

reviews.author: NightShade
reviews.title: Oh Honestly
reviews.comment_content:
PPTs and notes exist and are sufficient. Lab Notes are comprehensive. But you have to figure out the 'why' of everything yourself. The beginning is slow paced and easy to understand. If you're unfamiliar with the breadboard the practicals may take time getting used to.

Oh and do attend lectures because you never know when the four surprise quizzes might surprise you. And they should be an easy 8 percent
reviews.comment_teaching: For those who have not studied this previously, the basics were not explained. Prof may have been good, but the teaching left a lot to be desired. So really, it's a trap for newbies who want to know bout elec but have no background and skill.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair and square
For a good grade in practicals, choose lab partner carefully.
Written exams/quizzes needs a good logical understanding and (memorization of) what connects to what in which circuit.
I really do not recall the mean grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy because of the number of hours of slogging away in the laboratory every week and towards the end of the sem for the final project (literally day and night). But as exhilarating it is to watch your robot race, it'll be frustrating if you can't finish in time, because you've sacrificed precious hours for a low grade.

reviews.author: Aloha
reviews.title: Fly across the high sea
reviews.comment_content:
Circuits, Kirchhoff's circuit law, logic gate, sensor, diode, transistor, PWM, etc...
內容唔算太難 考試亦都唔算難
reviews.comment_teaching:
lecture: 教得幾好幾詳細 英文都唔差 會將啲嘢寫哂落白板 完堂後亦會將白板上面嘅note 扔上網 雖然好似係大陸人 但係會用廣東話同你講野(有少少唔正) project period會去lab度同學生鳩up 幾好人
tutorial: 冇上過 不予置評
reviews.comment_grading:
8% quiz
22% lab
15% lab midterm
20% written midterm
30% project demo
5% project report
me lab midterm >2sd written midterm >1.5sd 其他全full mark overall 99% A+ (未計bonus)
reviews.comment_workload:
Quiz: 成個sem共有2個quiz 1個喺sem中 1個係最後個lecture 好簡單嘅問題
lab: 7個 每個lab 有3粒鐘畀你做 2粒鐘內完成有bonus 而我不知道bonus有咩用 唔識做嘅話可以搵TA幫拖 lab worksheet有啲question可以答咗先上lab 慳返唔少時間
written midterm: 好淺 睇哂佢畀你嘅exercise就得
lab midterm: 都係好淺 但係時間會有啲緊湊 最好考之前玩熟啲儀器先
project: 砌一架車仔 好煩 debug de到痴撚咗線咁滯 舊電又廢又舊 掂兩野就爛 啲sensor又廢 sensation又差 差少少砌到我想揼爛部車 好易會發生啲意想不到嘅bug 尤其係喺demo前 建議搵個勁啲嘅partner 一個人debug嘅話都幾閉翳
完咗project後仲有個competition 鐘意嘅話可以玩下~
report: 跟住佢個guildeline寫要拎full mark唔難

reviews.author: MECH仔
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is quite easy. Basic electrical circuit and logic control. All the lab is to teach you to complete the final project.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is quite interesting and fun. Easy to understand the concept of the content of the course. Prof. is funny.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is good if you can complete the final project and attend all the lab and quiz.
Should have B or above if you can.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy workload.
Have a final project, two person a group.
Every week have lab and need to do pre-lab.
A few assignment and a few pop up quiz during lecture.
But only have written mid-term and lab mid-term, no final.

reviews.author: AA喝奶茶
reviews.comment_content:
内容不算复杂，上课仔细听都可以听懂。final前也会有T堂和lecture复习，不懂的东西也可以问prof和TA

具体的课程大纲如下：
1. introduction
2. components
3. energy
4. KCL & KVL
5. DC regulation
6. transistor
7. H bridge
8. DC motors
9. PWM control
10. sensors
11. boolean algebra
12. logic control
13. MCU arduino
14 & 15. programming
16. final project
17. written exam review
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Shen上课很幽默，讲课通俗易懂， PPT也很直接，课前20分钟看看基本就能get到。

TA Yimeng 非常温柔耐心，lab时有问必答。project调试的时候因为我的小车出了问题和我一起讨论了很久来帮我解决问题，电路搭错了也能一眼看出来问题
reviews.comment_grading:
对大部分人来说应该都是好龟课 只是本人学得太差了TT

我的情况大概是这样：
quiz 满分
lab 满分
midterm （操作）扣了2分
midterm （做题）没过 mean
project 满分
project report 满分
final 在mean
最后拿了B

个人感觉midterm的 writing part比较难，一些题目都需要想好几个点才能得到答案。但是final难度相对OK，熟练掌握知识点就可以了。
reviews.comment_workload:
lab report基本在堂内都能完成 作业不多

project编程难度有COMP1021水平就够用 小车也会在lab课里搭完 花时间最多的部分主要是编码调试和小车能不能完成全程的测试

最后的 project report因为在final周所以写得有点匆忙 这部分压力会大

reviews.author: ycohui
reviews.title: Basics is easy, real hard to compete tho
reviews.comment_content:
Content are getting easier. This semester seem reduced the syllabus comparing to previous ones.

Lecture Topics included in 2022 Fall:
Basics Electronic Components
Energy & Power (V = IR / E = VI / Ohm's Law)
KCL & KVL
DC Regulations (Diodes)
Transistors
H-bridges (More Transistors)
DC-Motors
Pulse & PWM
Sensors (Only for Final Project)
Boolean Algebra (Logics Gates)
Arduino C++ Programming  (Only for Final Project)

Labs:
#1: Learn to use equipments
#2: KCL & KVL
#3: Diodes & DC Regulations
#4: Transistors & H-Bridge
Lab Exam only include til Lab 4
#5 / 6: Arduino & Lab Car Assemble
Lab 5 & 6 will be learning for Project & Using for project materials

Projects:
Just make an Arduino control Robot follow the map.

Mostly basics were covered by HKDSE Physics Syllabus, except Logics & Transistors. However, don't think it would be good grade, as literally everyone who study this course is Engine Student and know these basics knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures
Prof Ki. Good but bored lecture, sleep pills for the morning 10:30 lesson. Also, all the lesson overrun til 12:00 end and iPRS at the end of lesson. However, he is friendly if you try to ask questions after lessons. He would be able to understand Cantonese.
( FYI, the TA is Yimeng and pretty friendly too, also quite rapid response by email. She would attend all lectures and you can ask her if you prefer Putunghua)

Labs & Tutorial
Yimeng (TA) is the tutor for the tutorial. Terrible accent and quite a slow pace for me to understand. But the details is kinda useful if you had no idea on the lab.
reviews.comment_grading:
Don't trust the grading policy. Just for your reference here:
Labs 30% + iPRS Quiz 10% + Lab Exam 15% + Written Exam 20% + Project ( Work Demo 20% + Written Report 5% )

Literally everyone can get full for all except Lab & Written Exam..... So the grade highly depend on your 2 exams and the mean is terrifically high.

Lab Exam: Mean 12.37/15 (S.D. 3.02)
Written Exam: Mean 71.18 / 100 (S.D. 19.86)
The final grade mean seems at about B+/B.
Don't be happy too much if total get below 90, becus it's C range for you.

However, I would say it's a decently good grade course, as the mean was given pretty good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload?

Except Lab & Project, nothing else.

Lab is important, but like only 3 hours per lab per week.

Project is more heavy, but only at November before final period. Get a good labmate who had experience tried to play robot before would help much on the final project car. As it's quite a rush to do within two weeks.

reviews.author: emperorpenguin
reviews.title: little workload but hard to get a satisfying grade
reviews.comment_content:
Quite easy, you don't need to review it after class because you can understand the concepts during the class or by learning by yourself before class.
Contents involve commonly used electronic components, from diodes to transistors. Also involves KCL and KVL calculation, H-bridge, resistors, and some basic ICs. Later on in the course, they teach us Arduino.

The final project involves building a robot car that follows a white line 'UST' on a black mat with an Arduino Nano board as the control unit. It needs good manipulative skills to build the robot car because some parts of your car may be broken down when you are testing. And you may own a demanding patient because the robot car is quite annoying. You can run your code normally yesterday but today your code may not run well due to many reasons.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Shen is a really good teacher. I like his humor when explaining different components and concepts. Honestly, I don't see any problem with his teaching! He teaches the contents at a moderate speed. Sometimes he may finish his class before the scheduled time because of the completion of the class. That is great for me because I have another lesson just after his class.
In the lab class, the TAs is quite good and can offer you help in time. (We are quite lucky to meet a TA from the mainland, so it is less demanding for me to communicate with him.)
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good for those careful students since the exam is not difficult and the mean is high. And the grades of labs matter in the whole grading system.

Policy:
Lab 30% (6 Labs in total)
Pop-up Quiz 10% (total 20, only top 60% answers will be recorded)
Lab Exam 15% (around October)
Written Exam 20% (around November)
Project Demo 20% (you get 2 trials, each trial allows you to submit 2 versions of code and 2 attempts per code)
Report 5%

My score:
Overall lab: 30/30 (almost everyone who follows the instructions given by TAs can get a grade close to 30)
Overall Quiz: 10/10
Lab Exam: 15/15, (μ=12.37, σ=3.02)
Written Exam: 97/100 (μ=71.18, σ=19.86)
Demo: 20/20
Report: 4.5/5 (make a mistake in the format)
Overall:98.9/100
Final Letter Grade: A+ (Very lucky and I think my efforts are worth it.)
reviews.comment_workload:
nearly zero since there are no assignments after class.
But you have to pay attention to this class anyway. For example, view the instructions before the lab and make full preparations for the exams and do the exercises given by teachers.
During the coding test session, the workload is quite heavy because of the uncertainty of the code. As a result, I didn't attend other classes which didn't record attendence to finish the final project.

reviews.author: Tiramisu1th
reviews.title: Not a good choice to farm grades
reviews.comment_content: There's nothing much new. The course starts with NSS Physics circuit things like P=IV, V=IR stuff and building circuits. Then introduced a few more things like diodes, transistors, and then introduced audrino and sensor thingy and proposition logic. Most importantly, you need to "build" a car following their step-by-step guide and write a code for the car to complete the objectives. A fun course, especially because the part of physically building a car was skipped due to pandemic
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor delivered the content quite clearly. In fact, even if you cannot understand the content, there exist plenty of internal resources that you can look up for without seeking any additional help. Even idiots can understand the knowledge if they are willing to put in some time and effort.
reviews.comment_grading: The number score is quite easy to obtain, as there are 55% from projects in total, and you can get at least 30% as long as you have at least one brain cell that can help you understand their step-by-step lab instructions. However, the letter grade is not as cash money as you think. I got 84.5/100 in this course, and its only a B. It is safe to assume that you need at least 90% for A range, which reduces a lot of room of error
reviews.comment_workload: Given that this course carries 4 credits, the workload is actually very little, even less than most 3 credit courses, as you only need to spend like a couple hours for the labs each week. More importantly, the course only lasted for around 2/3 of the semester, so the total workload is further reduced

reviews.author: MichaelWang
reviews.title: Low workload compared to other 4 cred courses
reviews.comment_content:
Very basic electric circuits, including KCL, KVL(what I think is the most difficult in the course)
Very basic propositional logic
Boolean algebra, half-adder, full-adder
Very basic Arduino programming that has tons of pre done codes, which you only need to know easy logic.
Final project is basically just building a line tracking car with two or three sensors.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is okay. It isn't that important since you could basically understand everything just by reading through the slides. For the KCL, KVL which I think is more difficult, just go on YouTube and you'll learn from Indian accents.
reviews.comment_grading:
The online setting made the A range cutoff easier to attain, around 90 still gets an A-
From what I've heard from friends who enroll in f2f setting, 90 should be a B.
However, the grading only consists of an exam and the final project, other assignments are basically not influential to the grade since everyone gets a high score.
I screwed up the tinkercad problem in the exam which got me -20, causing me to get an A-. Have to get as high as possible to get a really good grade.
For the project, if you want to get A or A+, you would have to get full marks, which would require some programming skills (but not too difficult tho)
One thing to mention is that the exam is basically just pastpapers adding up together cuz the professors are too lazy to make up new questions. Go on goop or something to buy pastpapers would give you a fking big advantage.
reviews.comment_workload: The class ends like 1.5 months before the semester ends, though it's labelled as a four credit course, it is not difficult and no finals are great. I would recommend it to take as an engineering introduction course, though might not be too much a good grade.

reviews.author: agoti
reviews.title: (Online courses) Not recommended if you want A range
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty OK.

Basically a slightly advanced version of secondary school circuitry. Introduces new circuit stuff like transistors, diodes, capacitors, logic gates, timers, etc but not much calculation for those is required (you can always follow the given equations)

Also introduces some circuitry calculation/planning concepts like KVL/KCL and K-map. Nothing too hard tho.

The whole goal of the course is to give your the minimum knowledge to make a robot-controlling circuit board (+ program), so not much is really taught in depth.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Meh.

Professors and TAs tend to be pretty helpful (at least this time around) because of the difficulty in building circuitry without a physical circuit.

There's nothing particularly bad about the teaching method, it's just hindered by the fact that this course had to be online and labs are just "connect the dots in this simulation website" plus a bit of paperwork.
reviews.comment_grading:
It's not hard to get to B+ if you basically grasped everything in the course. The real challenge comes from the fact that the robot trials are done "online" (remotely by sending your program to the TAs and let them run by themselves).

Welcome to the biggest Online Casino of HKUST.

You are only given 5 trials, 3 different submission attempts and no other possible way of testing whether your robot works in real life. You can make it work in theory, which gives you 14/20 points (20% of final grade), but the rest depends on whether your robot is lucky enough to not bug out when running through the track. Otherwise comes the nondeterministic filter that separates lucky A-rangers from the unlucky B-or-less grades. (Unless you do exceptionally well in the "written" exam)

If you really aim for A range, this course is not for you.
reviews.comment_workload:
It's less "heavy workload" but "unfair correlation between workload and actual grade". The workload is pretty light. 6 labs (basically connecting the dots, as said above), 1 homework (which is decent as a practice) and the final project (and PRS).

Since there is no way to test your project in real life (other than buying the circuits yourself or spending the trials), the project (which takes a good portion of the grading) doesn't really reward based on effort, but on luck.

I'd rather have a heavier workload than have a result that I couldn't have controlled.

Project Proposal (30%)

My Score:

Lab Midterm: 20/20
Project Proposal: 30/30

Pop-up Quiz 1: 10/10
Pop-up Quiz 2: 10/10
Pop-up Quiz 3: 0/10

Lab Midterm ------- Mean: 13.46, S.D.: 5.52
Project Proposal -------- Mean: Abt 28
Pop-up Quiz ------- Mean: Abt 6-7

reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is fair compared to other 1000-level courses.

No Homework

Lectures: Can be skipped except for those with a pop-up quiz (At the end of the lesson). It will be good to have a friend that reminds you of the pop-up quiz. The pop-up quizzes are open book, you can read the lecture notes while you are doing.

Tutorials: Can be skipped.

Labs: Cannot be skipped. A good lab mate helps you a lot. Otherwise, you might have to complete everything on your own.

Exams: Not difficult if you are well-prepared. I studied 2 days before the exams and I got good grades.
The lab midterm lasts for 75 mins with 3 questions, quite a rush for some people.
The written exam lasts for 100 mins with 5 questions, time is sufficient.

**********************************************************************
Remember to complete all sample papers, some questions in the written exam are directly copied from that.
**********************************************************************

Final project: Replaced by a project proposal, which requires us to complete a 2000-word proposal within 6 pages. Less workload than the original project, I guess.

reviews.author: jddyg
reviews.title: Interesting Course With Good Grade
reviews.comment_content: The course introduces the basic knowledge of robots, and students will have chances to build their robot car during labs and the project.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Generally, Prof. Shao is a good instructor. He taught with a clear mind and focused on the lecture notes. He also stays at the LT after lectures to answer questions.
The TAs are also very kind and always willing to help. I caught up with Covid last semester and was away from campus for two weeks. Luckily, with the help of TAs, I caught up with the lectures and labs, and I still got a good grade at the end of the semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
One of the easiest courses to get an A+ in UST.
Quizzes in lecture + Labs + Exam + Project.
Attend all the lectures and labs, finish the quizzes and lab tasks, prepare for the exam, finish the project on time, and you will have a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
No written homework.
There was only one written exam (no need to prepare for the exam twice). Just review what was taught during the lecture every weekend or every month, and try the past papers before the exam, then you will get a good grade.
The only thing that may be tough about this course is the project, but students will have two weeks to finish it (the project report is even due later, several days after the demonstration), so it should be alright.

reviews.author: Fred Kung
reviews.title: Good grade and little workload
reviews.comment_content: The course introduces the fundamental knowledge on the design, implementation and evaluation of a robot and its sub-systems. It covers the basic principles of analog and digital circuits as well as robot sensing and control mechanisms. Students have to apply the knowledge and principles learned to design and build a functional robot by the end of the course. Students who have completed ELEC 2200, ELEC 2350, ELEC 2400, ELEC 2420, or ELEC 3310, must obtain instructor's approval to take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is humorous though his tone may make people a little sleepy. Good teaching in general.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite good if the student is careful in exams and pay attention to each lecture. The grading policy is reasonable. The instructor and the tutors are all considerate people who are willing to help students in and after classes.
reviews.comment_workload:
Little written workoad.
There are only iPRS questions in class but no compulsory homework.
The final project may take up some time.

reviews.author: CHeeseDog0729
reviews.comment_content: The contents are easy, basically everything your need to build the robot car.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very good. Though Vinod has some accent but I don't think it will affect understanding. He explains all the contents clearly, and you will understand every contents after attending his lecture.

Yimeng also explains things well in tutorials, you will know clearly what you need to do in labs and how to solve the problems which will be tested in the exam after attending the tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading:
iPRS 15%
Project Report 5%
Project Demo 20%
Labs 30%
Final (but taken at the end of midterm period) 30%

I got 95.25% overall and A-. I got full marks in every items except for the final. So the grading is pretty crazy! The contents are just too easy that everyone got very high marks. I think you need to get 97% to get an A and nearly 100% to get A+.

I think it would be better if they increase the weighting on the project and project report. Everyone spent so much time on the project yet it weights less than the labs just makes no sense. There are so many to write in the project report but it only contributes 5% to the total grade, and it seems that as soon as you have included everything requires in the project report then you get full points. As a result, everyone got full points in every items and your grade only depends on the exam.

Good grade or not really depends on what you expect. If you are satisfied with B+ or A-, then it would be a leng grade course!
reviews.comment_workload:
No workload except for attending the lecture and tutorials and finishing the project. The exam is not difficult but I still think you need to have a thorough understanding of the course materials. The time spent on the project differs among groups, some people spent only a day or two, and some spent a whole week or more. My groupmate and I spent about three to four afternoons to finish it.

A good groupmate will definitely help lower your workload on labs and the project. Good luck on that!

reviews.author: charlieop
reviews.comment_content: The content is fine, but for one has basic knowledge in circuits and electronics, it might be too easy
reviews.comment_teaching: Most of the contents in the class are the same with the class notes, and there is not a lot of meaning to listen
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading consists of:
15% class participant (IPRS quizzes which is very easy and only require a 70% correct rate)

30% Lab, which is almost sure that can be earned

30% midterm exams, which covers most of the lecture part. Questions are similar to those explained on the classes  and it is pretty easy.

20% + 5% final project It could be a little challenging for ppl who know little about programming.If that's the case, choose your labmate wisely :)

Overall, this course is pretty easy and I got a 99.5/100 overall score
reviews.comment_workload: Only the final project requires some hardworking. For the first half semester, all you need to do is go to attend the class (for the IPRS quiz)

reviews.author: tttts
reviews.comment_content:
Lectures in the first month are pretty simple for students who have basic E&M understanding in secondary school, consisting of content about AC/DC, voltage, current, resistance. Then it moves onto more advanced electronic stuff like PWM, transistors, H-bridge, KCL & KVL, logic gates, and K-map.

While lectures focus on concepts, and sometimes it would be more like a physics class.
Tutorials mostly teach how labs are done and most importantly contain examples for the circuit arrangements. There will be the detail connection information on every single wire on the breadboard which makes it extremely easy to connect the wire in the lab.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Average.
SHAO himself has great and deep understanding on ELEC, but maybe the content of the class restricted his lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
6x Labs (40%)
1x Written Midterm Exam (25%)
2x Pop-up Quizzes (10%) (Totally 3 pop-up quizzes but only count the best 2)
1x Final Project(25%) (20final project+5report)
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite light for a 4-credit course.
But the debugging process was kind of depressing and there might be an array of unexpected accident during the final project period which make you anxious and helpless.

reviews.author: Renekton
reviews.title: Good introduction course(except for the project)
reviews.comment_content: ELEC1100 is designed to provide fundamental knowledge in electrical engineering, basic electronic components and the skills needed for the design, implementation and evaluation of a robot and its subsystems.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is not bad. The professor and TA （Fox） are patient.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 1 online exam (30%), 6 online lab assignments (30% total), 4 Pop-up In-class quizzes , best 3 will be counted(open book, 15% total), and one final project, Coding project (20%) and project report (5%).
The labs and quizzes are free marks. The online exam is also not hard. The final project is
troublesome.
My grade:
online exam:84/100
lab assignments: full marks.
quiz: full marks.
Coding project: 14/20.
project report: full marks.
Final grade: A+. So the grade is very good.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload except for the project. The project is really time-consuming.

reviews.author: Amen Yeung
reviews.comment_content:
好基本Physics概念，比較淺白，
相信Year1都容易上手。
reviews.comment_teaching:
無特別，十分容易，
自己溫Notes便可以，
可走Lecture，但LAB一定要出席，不能走，
二人一組做Project。
reviews.comment_grading: 靚Grade，完成Project B range就無問題，否則一定C range，推薦花多啲時間做。
reviews.comment_workload: 除左最尾的Project其他都較少，所以Year1必讀。

reviews.author: JonathanChi
reviews.title: Midterm is everything
reviews.comment_content: Starts with some basic physics, and then introduces some key components for building the robot car. Following with H-bridge, KCL/KVL, K-map, logic, and Arduino coding.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is nice and is willing to answer questions after class. some contents require extra time to fully understand the concept. TAs are also really nice in lab sessions. Overall the teaching team is great.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm is everything for a f2f semester. Basically, most people can get full marks on the robot car demo. so try to get as high as you can in the midterm exam. Midterm is easy, so just don't mess it up and you can get a good grade.

full mark in everything except midterm. 97.5/100 in the midterm.
Get an A+.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is manageable. No take-home assignments at all. the workload mostly comes from the project period. you have to spend a lot of time testing your car however if you can finish the demo in the early demo, you can have at least one week back to prepare for other exams.

reviews.author: river
reviews.comment_content: An interesting class. Fantastic content. The only fly in this ointment is that this class was hold online. So the lab part is a little bit boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: prof is from India so sometimes it is hard to follow his English. But he is a very nice person and he will say good morning to you before class. Miss Tang is very nice
reviews.comment_grading: I screwed the final. But still got B+. However the grading about project report can be very ambiguous.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light. No midterm but have a final project.

reviews.author: 江湖夜雨十年燈
reviews.title: A lovely course
reviews.comment_content:

reviews.comment_teaching: Lovely professor, humourous Indian. You will get accustommed to his accent soon. He is very kind. The TA Tang, Yimeng is also very nice. It has been 2 years since the course turned to online, and I am very lucky to enroll this course this semester, in my 2nd year.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Policy

Lab: 6 Lab Assignments (30% total).
Quiz: Pop-up In-class Quizzes (open book, 15% total), online submission in iPRS, only the top 70% of your performance will be counted.
Exam: On-line Exam (close book, 30%).
Project: Project Demo (20%) and report (5%).

My grades:
LAB:29.7/30
Quiz:15/15
Exam:95/100
Project:25/25

Final grade : A+
reviews.comment_workload: Except for the stupid car's debugging, there is nothing stressful. The contents are quite easy, just basic electricity and circuits, if you are from mainland, I suppose you will be able to conquer this course easily. If you know C++, the programming will also be a piece of cake.

reviews.comment_workload: workload 也还好，整体来说没有很累，甚至是轻松。

reviews.author: uraniumgun1127
reviews.title: 교수님의 명강의가 인상에 남는 수업
reviews.comment_content: 전자공학을 시작하기위한 기초 지식을 탄탄히 쌓을수 있게 구성돼있습니다. 수업 첫날부터 마지막까지 배운 직류, 교류, 정류, 킬크호프에 법칙, KCL, KVL, 로직설계 등등 모든 지식들을 마지막 프로젝트에서 모두 적용할수 있게 수업범위가 구성되어 있습니다. 개인적으로 콘텐트가 매우 탄탄하다고 생각되는 과목입니다.
reviews.comment_teaching:
교수님: SONG, Shenghui

능숙한 영어발음에 시간낭비 없이 간결하고 정확한 설명. 재치있는 유머감각에 꿈을 향한 도전정신까지 일깨워주는 이 과목의 화룡점정.
reviews.comment_grading:
모 아니면 도. 당신의 성적은 마지막 프로젝트에 대박칠수도 쪽박칠수도 있습니다.

몇번의 수업퀴즈, 랩, 리포트, 중간고사, 랩 시험, 마지막 프로젝트등 그레이딩이 다양하게 분포되어있습니다

수업깜짝퀴즈:
수업중 랜덤한 날에 퀴즈가 있습니다. 그러므로 무조건 결석하지 맙시다.

랩:
출석해서 하라는 것만 해도 무난합니다. 단 4번째 랩부턴 어려워지고 보너스 점수를 못받거나 3시간안에 못끝내서 점수를 못얻을수도 있기 때문에 미리 주어지는 lab instruction을 무조건 읽고 가시길 추천합니다

랩 시험:
사람마다 쉬울수도 어려울 수도 있어서 호불호가 심하게 갈립니다만 그동안 랩에서 배웠던 실습지식과 당신의 번개같은 손이 있다면 준비는 끝난겁니다

중간고사:
피피티로 공부할 때는 쉬웠을 지도 모르겠지만 중간고사는 그렇지 않을겁니다. 난이도가 상당하므로 준비를 철처히 해가지 않으면 멘붕에 빠집니다. 그렇지만 mean도 낮습니다.

마지막 프로젝트:
이 과목의 최종보스입니다. 로봇이 끝가지 작동만 잘해도 그동안에 성적에서 평타가 나왔으면 대부분 A를 보장해 준다 생각합니다. 이 프로젝트가 당신의 성적을 결정짓습니다. 랩에서 밤을 새고 로직을 계속 써나가는 과정은 굉장히 고통스러울 겁니다. 그저 무운을 빕니다.

랩 리포트:
분량이 많은편도 아니고 적당히 충실히 쓰면 되니 크게 걱정 않해도 됩니다.
reviews.comment_workload: 학기동안 과제가 있진 않습니다만 마지막 프로젝트는 헬입니다.
